0.title: Maharashtra reports 121 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths reported
0.article_body: Maharashtra on Friday reported 121 new COVID-19 cases taking its cumulative tally to 7,876,503, the latest health department bulletin showed. There was no fresh casualty reported in the state, which means the overall death toll remains at 1,47,831. This was for the fourth day Maharashtra saw more than 100 new cases in a single day.

1.title: Not even 1 poll promise fulfilled by Punjab AAP govt so far: Chugh
1.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh on Friday said the AAP government in Punjab hasn't fulfilled 'even a single poll promise' so far. He claimed that the party's promised immediate implementation of 300 units of free electricity has now been pushed back till July. He also accused AAP of using the state's resources to fulfil political motives in other states.

2.title: Centre to chalk roadmap for pharma, medical devices: Mandaviya
2.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that the central government will engage with industry and academia to chalk a roadmap for pharma and medical devices for the next 25 years. "India shall soon get the competitive edge in medical devices with research and innovation," he said ahead of the 7th edition of India Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices Conference 2022.

3.title: Suman Bery named NITI Aayog Vice Chairperson as Rajiv Kumar steps down
3.article_body: Economist Dr Suman K Bery has been appointed the Vice Chairperson of NITI Aayog after Dr Rajiv Kumar stepped down from his post on Friday. Kumar took over as Vice Chairperson in 2017 after his predecessor Arvind Panagariya exited the government think-tank to return to academics. Bery was the Director-General of National Council of Applied Economic Research (NCAER) from 2001-2011.

4.title: Help shopkeepers threatened by BJP: Manish Sisodia to AAP MLAs
4.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia directed Aam Aadmi Party MLAs to help landlords and shopkeepers. He alleged that some people associated with BJP are 'threatening them by running bulldozers at their shops if they don't pay them money'. He wrote a letter to AAP MLAs saying that they can also register a complaint against such people.

5.title: Chahal's mindset has made him a world-class bowler: Lalchand Rajput
5.article_body: Talking about Yuzvendra Chahal, who is currently the leading wicket-taker in IPL 2022, Lalchand Rajput said the RR spinner's mindset and attitude are transforming him from a good bowler into a world-class bowler. "The way he runs before going to bowl, tells how much confidence he has. The graph has certainly improved for Chahal," he added.

6.title: Odisha Police organise wedding of 2 former Naxals
6.article_body: Odisha's Kalahandi district police on Friday organised the wedding of two former Naxals, who were earlier associated with a Maoist group. The bride and the groom, aged 25 and 29 respectively, had surrendered and lived on the police reserve campus. "Since both...have been with us for so long, we decided to make it...police family function," the police superintendent said.

7.title: 200 more mass graves found near Ukraine's Mariupol, satellite pic released
7.article_body: A satellite picture shared by US firm Maxar Technologies has claimed to show 200 more mass graves near the Ukrainian city of Mariupol, amid Russia's invasion of the country. Local officials have accused Russia of burying up to 9,000 Ukrainian civilians in the town of Manhush outside Mariupol. Russia had on Thursday claimed victory in the battle for Mariupol.

8.title: Cong wants to break trend of Raj govt changing every 5 yrs: Pilot
8.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the party is aiming to retain power in the 2023 Rajasthan Assembly polls and break the 30-year-old tradition of the government changing in the state every five years. Pilot, who met Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Thursday said that the latter is "very keen...we all work unitedly to form government in Rajasthan again".

9.title: After COVID-19, Goa is the safest destination for tourists: CM
9.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Friday said that after COVID-19, Goa is the safest destination for tourists. The Goa CM said that with the help of the PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government, Goa is set to promote spiritual and medical tourism based on public-private partnership. He also praised the central government for giving a boost to Goa shipyards.

10.title: I was completely broken: Isha Koppikar on losing film after refusing to meet a star alone
10.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar, speaking to Bollywood Hungama, recalled an incident wherein a star had told her he wanted to meet her without her staff. The actress had refused to do so and was dropped from the film, she said. "I was completely broken. More than broken, disillusioned...because...I didn't know...you had to be in the good books of heroes," Isha stated.

11.title: Man paddleboards to work in UK, saves over ₹2 lakh a year in petrol & parking costs
11.article_body: Alex Kell, a financial planner from Gloucester, paddleboards to work that helps him save around £2,500 (more than ₹2 lakh) over a year in petrol and parking costs. "I've paddleboarded for about five or six years," he told Euro News. "Commuting to work on a paddleboard is pretty peaceful," Kell further stated.

12.title: Cong snatched rights of Himachal Pradesh, BJP safeguarded it: Nadda
12.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda, while addressing a public rally in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra on Friday, said that Congress has always snatched the rights of the state while the BJP government has safeguarded the rights. He said, "Congress leaders only talk about dynastic politics, casteism, communalism...But PM Narendra Modi has taken development forward by giving a tough competition to all this."

13.title: I look up to Big B, Ajay Devgn: CarryMinati on doing 'Runway 34'
13.article_body: YouTuber CarryMinati, who will make his Bollywood debut in Ajay Devgn and Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Runway 34', has said that the actors are personalities he looks up to. He further said that he agreed to be a part of the film because he essays his own character (CarryMinati). "I eat, breathe, sleep and live my character every single day," he added.

14.title: Fans claim 'Moon Knight' theme similar to 'Mahabharat' title track
14.article_body: A video claiming that the background score of Marvel series 'Moon Knight' is very similar to the title track of Indian television series 'Mahabharat' is going viral on social media. The background score for 'Moon Knight' has been composed by Egyptian composer Hesham Nazih. This comes after fans claimed that there were similarities in scenes of 'Shang-Chi' and Bajirao Mastani'.

15.title: How is Josh in IPL 2022, Buttler sir: RP Singh on RR opener's 3rd ton
15.article_body: Following opener Jos Buttler's third century for RR in IPL 2022, RP Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "How is the Josh in IPL 2022? Buttler sir!" Michael Vaughan tweeted, "No one is anywhere close to batting like Buttler in T20 cricket at the moment...Incredible." Buttler scored 116 runs in 65 balls against DC at Wankhede Stadium on Friday.

16.title: Hardik is necessary for India in T20 World Cup 2022: Manjrekar
16.article_body: Sanjay Manjrekar said all-rounder Hardik Pandya should be included in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia as the team might need a back-up seamer. "Hardik is necessary because India have three seamers who are likely to play," he added. Manjrekar further said Hardik can be sixth bowling option as he has done well in Australian conditions before.

17.title: Bomb blast at mosque during Friday prayers kill 33 people in Afghanistan
17.article_body: A blast at a Sunni mosque during Friday prayers killed at least 33 people in Afghanistan's Kunduz. Zabihullah Mujahid, Taliban spokesperson, confirmed the death toll on Twitter and said 43 people had also been wounded. "The perpetrators of these incidents are...evil elements and serious efforts are being made to arrest and punish them," he said.

18.title: Haryana to host grand 400th Parkash Purab celebration on April 24
18.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar announced that the state government is going to host a grand celebration in Panipat on April 24 to mark the 400th Parkash Purab of the ninth Sikh Guru Tegh Bahadur. As part of the preparations for the event, a cleanliness drive was carried out in Panipat on Friday morning.

19.title: Issue red corner notice against man who broke orders: HC to CBI
19.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed the CBI to take steps against a man, Karan Goel, who violated the conditions imposed on him by the court. The court asked the CBI to issue a red corner notice against him for taking his daughter to Nepal. It directed Goel to produce his daughter before the court on the next day of hearing.

20.title: Minor among 2 arrested over communal riots in Gujarat's Khambhat
20.article_body: Two persons, including a minor, have been booked in connection with the April 10 riots in Gujarat's Khambhat, police said. The pair were caught from the Yakutpura area by the Vadodara Prevention of Crime Branch on Friday based on a tip-off. The communal clashes that broke out during Ram Navami processions had left one person dead and several injured.

21.title: He'll become England's T20 captain soon: Vaughan on Buttler
21.article_body: Michael Vaughan has said Jos Buttler is best T20 player in the world and soon he'll become England T20 captain. "If not for this [T20] World Cup, definitely for...next one. He's that sort of a cricketer," he added. Vaughan further said that RR's decision to retain Buttler this season was a "no-brainer". Buttler is currently the leading-scorer in IPL 2022.

22.title: 300-yr-old temple demolished in Rajasthan; 'idols were shifted out', says official
22.article_body: A 300-year-old Shiva temple was demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar on Friday, with a video of the demolition being widely shared online, triggering a political row. DM Shivprasad Nakate said the demolition was done to remove illegal encroachments and the temple's idols were shifted to another place by priests. Rajasthan minister Shanti Dhariwal said it was the municipal council's decision.

23.title: Notice to MP over Hanuman Chalisa recitation outside Maha CM's house
23.article_body: After MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana said they plan to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside the residence of Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, they were sent a notice by the Mumbai Police. The notice was sent under Section 149 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, which allows the police to act in the interest of preventing cognisable offences.

24.title: Pic shows Johnny Depp 'passed out' on couch with ice cream spilled on his lap
24.article_body: The jury hearing actor Johnny Depp's defamation suit against ex-wife Amber Heard was shown a series of images on Thursday, including a photo of him 'passed out' on a couch with ice cream spilled on his lap. He said Heard took the photo in Boston in 2014. A picture of four large bags of marijuana was also shown.

25.title: Jos Buttler smashes joint-most sixes in an IPL 2022 match
25.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler has equalled the record for smashing the most number of sixes in an IPL 2022 match. The 31-year-old smashed nine sixes in his knock of 116(65) against DC on Friday. He equalled the record set by CSK opener Robin Uthappa, who had slammed nine sixes against RCB on April 12.

26.title: Imran Khan praises India, says 'India thinks for its own people before other nations'
26.article_body: Pakistan's ex-PM Imran Khan praised India at a rally, saying that India "thinks for its own people before benefit of other countries". "India, is a strategic ally of US, is taking oil from Russia. When New Delhi was told to not buy the oil, it straightaway said 'we take decisions based on what's good for our country'," Khan said.

27.title: RR smash the highest total of IPL 2022, break their own record
27.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) on Friday registered the highest total of IPL 2022 so far after recording 222/2 in their 20 overs against Delhi Capitals (DC). Jos Buttler top-scored for RR with 116(65), while his opening partner Devdutt Padikkal scored 54(35). The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 217/5 registered by RR against KKR on Monday.

28.title: Future Retail's secured lenders reject deal to sell retail assets to Reliance
28.article_body: Future Retail said on Friday that nearly 70% of its secured creditors have rejected the ₹24,713-crore deal to sell the group's retail assets to Reliance Industries. Its unsecured creditors and shareholders, however, approved the deal, Future said in an exchange filing. The company has failed to receive the requisite 75% favourable votes from secured creditors for the deal, reports said.

29.title: Many unseen hands behind Hubli violence: Karnataka Home Minister
29.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Friday said that many "unseen hands" were behind the recent violence in Hubli. "Some people are trying to create unrest in...society against a particular community and some organisations are involved in it. We're aware who they are," Jnanendra added. Four policemen were injured and several vehicles were damaged in the April 16 stone-pelting incident.

30.title: IAS officer shares pic of 'solution' after tweet on gutkha-laced saliva on Howrah Bridge
30.article_body: After IAS officer Awanish Sharan's viral tweet on gutkha-laced saliva corroding Howrah Bridge, he shared a picture of measures taken by Kolkata Port trust to solve the issue. It showed a partially red painted pillar being covered. "Now those who spit gutka won't have to face any 'guilt'...The bridge can also be protected from 'harmful chemical of gutka'," he tweeted.

31.title: Don't have any interest in leading England Test team: Morgan
31.article_body: England's limited-overs skipper Eoin Morgan said he doesn't have any interest in leading the Test team after Joe Root quit captaincy recently. "I'm very happy with the role that I play within the white-ball team and English cricket at the moment...my career is firmly focused on World Cups," he added. Morgan hasn't played a Test match since February 2012.

32.title: Witness in wife's murder case shot dead in Haryana court complex
32.article_body: A man, who was a prime witness in his wife's murder case, was shot dead inside Haryana's Sonipat district courts complex by two armed men on Friday. Ved Prakash's wife, Kanika, was allegedly strangled to death and thrown into a canal by her father who was against their marriage. Police are trying to ascertain if both the deaths are linked.

33.title: PM Modi intervened many times with Putin to ask what on earth he's doing: UK PM
33.article_body: Speaking about Russia-Ukraine war, UK PM Boris Johnson said, "Talking to PM Narendra Modi today, it's clear that he has...intervened several times with Vladimir Putin to ask him what on earth he thinks he is doing." "What the Indians want is peace and they want the Russians out. And I totally agree with that," Johnson on PM's intervention.

34.title: 10-ft-long squid washes ashore alive in Japan in rare sighting, video surfaces
34.article_body: In a rare sighting, a giant squid was found stranded alive on a shore in western Japan on Wednesday. The squid measuring around 10 feet was found stranded at Ugu beach in Obama of Fukui Prefecture and a video of the same has been shared online. Squids of this size are deep-sea dwelling creatures.

35.title: There's 'realistic possibility' Russia could win war in Ukraine: UK PM
35.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Friday said that there is a "realistic possibility" that Russia could win its war in Ukraine. He, however, said that "no matter what military superiority" Russian President Vladimir Putin had, he would not be able to "conquer the spirit of the Ukrainian people". "We've...got to keep intensifying the economic sanctions [against Russia]," PM Johnson added.

36.title: T20 is a cruel format, MI need to grab crunch moments: Tendulkar
36.article_body: Calling T20 format "cruel" following MI's seven-match losing streak in IPL 2022, mentor Sachin Tendulkar said the team needs to conquer the crunch moments to win the matches. "Those crucial moments in a match which don't go in your favour then literally the margin is like you lose a game by two or three runs...sometimes even [on]...last ball," he added.

37.title: Jos Buttler becomes second player in IPL history to smash 3 hundreds in a season
37.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler has become the second player after Virat Kohli in IPL history to smash three hundreds in a season. The 31-year-old achieved the feat after reaching the three-figure mark off 57 deliveries against DC on Friday. Buttler's other two hundreds in IPL 2022 came against MI and KKR. Kohli had slammed four hundreds in IPL 2016.

38.title: Delhi reports 1,042 new COVID-19 cases & 2 deaths, positivity rate at 4.6%
38.article_body: Delhi on Friday reported 1,042 fresh COVID-19 cases as compared to 965 cases on Thursday. The city also recorded 2 COVID-19 related deaths in the last 24 hours, while 757 people recovered from the disease in one day. The national capital's daily COVID-19 positivity rate is at 4.64% as compared to Thursday's 4.7%.

39.title: NASA has become an ATM machine to fuel Musk, Bezos' space race: Sanders
39.article_body: US Senator Bernie Sanders has expressed his concerns over NASA providing subsidies to private space companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin. He said, "NASA has become...an ATM machine to fuel a space race...between the two wealthiest men in America - Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos." Sanders added that space exploration can make the richest people in the world incredibly richer.

40.title: If anyone else was earning, mom Shweta would stay home: Palak
40.article_body: Palak Tiwari has stated her mother Shweta Tiwari has always been a sole earner, adding she wants to earn to provide for her half-brother Reyansh's education. "If anyone else was earning...in the family, she would've stayed home with him," Palak said. Palak is Shweta's daughter with first husband Raja Chaudhary and Reyansh is her son with second husband Abhinav Kohli.

41.title: Protesters remove SilverLine project survey stones in Kerala
41.article_body: Protesters on Friday removed survey stones that were laid by K-Rail officials for the SilverLine semi-high speed rail project in the Edakkad area in Kerala's Kannur district. This comes a day after clashes broke out between Congress workers and police in Thiruvananthapuram during a protest against the project. The project is estimated to cost around ₹60,000 crore.

42.title: Mysuru man strangles 31-yr-old wife to death over alleged affair
42.article_body: A man allegedly strangled his 31-year-old wife to death in Karnataka's Mysuru district following an argument over her mobile addiction and an alleged affair. The crime came to light three days later when the victim's brother went to meet her on Wednesday and found a foul smell emanating from the house. The accused has confessed to the crime, police said.

43.title: Kohli has the best cover drive between him and Babar: Buttler
43.article_body: On being asked who has the best cover drive between Virat Kohli and Babar Azam, RR opener Jos Butter replied, "I am going to say Kohli." Notably, Kohli has failed to score a century in his last 100 matches across all formats. The RCB batter has so far scored 119 runs from seven matches in ongoing IPL.

44.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹6 crore of Saradha Group of Companies
44.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth ₹6.28 crore of Saradha Group of Companies in Assam under provisions of Prevention of Money Laundering Act, the agency said. According to ED, the Saradha Group of Companies ran illegal ponzi schemes by befooling people. The companies had invested in various movable and immovable properties to launder the proceeds of crime, a probe revealed.

45.title: Pic from IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi's wedding with IAS officer Pradeep Gawande surfaces
45.article_body: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi got married to Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer in a private ceremony in Jaipur on Wednesday. A picture from the wedding, in which a photograph of Dr BR Ambedkar can also be seen in the background, has surfaced online. The couple reportedly sent out invitations for a reception on April 22.

46.title: Momentum is lost: Poonawalla on COVID-19 vaccination pace in India
46.article_body: SII CEO Adar Poonawalla has called for the lowering of the vaccination gap to six months from nine months. "Taking decisions on time as we did during the second wave is the need of the hour," said Poonawalla on vaccination. "But, unfortunately for the key people...it seems there's no urgency...The momentum...that brought us...here is lost...it's business as usual," he added.

47.title: Bride secretly laces wedding food with weed, arrested after guests fall sick in US
47.article_body: A 42-year-old bride and her 31-year-old caterer were arrested after they allegedly laced food on the wedding menu with weed secretly, leading to some guests getting hospitalised in US' Michigan. The wedding which took place in February was attended by 50 guests. The groom said the wedding guests were not aware about marijuana-laced desserts and lasagna.

48.title: Anand Mahindra shares photos taken by him on Earth Day
48.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Friday shared images of different places that he had photographed. "I don't have any sermons to share today, on #EarthDay...some photographs I've taken over the years. My own personal celebration of this planet...Do share your celebratory photos," he wrote. Several Twitter users replied in the comments section by sharing pictures taken by them.

49.title: World's longest-known COVID infection lasted 505 days in UK patient who died: Study
49.article_body: A COVID-19 patient in the UK had the viral infection for 505 days, which is the longest recorded infection of the novel coronavirus as per a study. He tested positive in early 2020, was treated with the antiviral drug Remdesivir and passed away in 2021. The patient had a severely weakened immune system and had several other illnesses.

50.title: Had flings after being let down; more I dated, lonelier I felt: Vivek
50.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi has revealed in an interview that after his breakup with actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in 2003, he felt very let down and became cynical and bitter. The actor further said that he just wanted to have flings. "I explored that path and the more girls I dated, the more lonely I felt," Vivek added.

51.title: Amnesty India criticises UK PM over pics with JCB bulldozer in Guj, calls him 'ignorant'
51.article_body: Amnesty India has criticised UK PM Boris Johnson after he visited JCB factory in Gujarat and got pictures clicked with a bulldozer. "In the backdrop of Municipal Corporation of Delhi using JCB bulldozers to raze down shops of Muslims in...Jahangirpuri...UK PM's inauguration of a JCB factory...is not only ignorant but his silence on the incident is deafening," it tweeted.

52.title: I started out by cleaning & wiping off vomit from the studio floors: Raveena Tandon
52.article_body: Raveena Tandon, speaking about interning with Prahlad Kakkar and making her way up, told Mid-Day, "I did start from cleaning...studio floors to wiping off vomit from the...studio floors." "Even at that time they used to say 'What are you doing behind the screen, you've to be in front of the screen...and I'd be like 'Me, an actress? Never'," she added.

53.title: DC to bowl first against RR, both teams unchanged
53.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 match on Friday. Both the playing XIs are unchanged. RR are currently third on the points table with eight points from six matches, while DC are placed sixth with six points from six matches.

54.title: 'Nil Battey Sannata' has same resonating value even after 6yrs: Producer
54.article_body: 'Nil Battey Sannata' producer Aanand L Rai stated that the film has the same resonating value even after six years of release. He further said he had to make the film the moment he read the script because its emotions were pure. "(Director) Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari and (actress) Swara Bhasker did a fantastic job [bringing]...a beautiful story alive," Aanand added.

55.title: Pune's Tarini Moghe among 18 winners of Ayush Master Chef competition
55.article_body: Pune-based Tarini Moghe was among the 18 winners of the pan-India Ayush Master Chef competition. All India Institute of Ayurveda had announced the competition aimed at making people aware of the nutritional value of forgotten native ingredients and recipes by giving them a modern twist. Tarini made 'moong-stuffed roll-ups’ in the finale round and earned a cash reward of ₹75,000.

56.title: Lyrid meteor shower to peak tonight, will be visible in Indian skies
56.article_body: The annual Lyrid meteor shower (debris from the Thatcher Comet) will peak tonight and will reportedly be visible in Indian skies. The meteors will shoot past the Earth till April 29 and as per experts, up to 18 shooting stars can be visible during the shower's peak. They'll reportedly be visible in Delhi, Kolkata and elsewhere early in the morning.

57.title: Police must be ahead of criminals, must be tech-savvy: Amit Shah
57.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday spoke about the revival of the Khabri (informer) system and reforms in policing practices across the country. "It's imperative that police have to be ahead of the criminals, they have to become tech-savvy," Shah said while inaugurating the 48th All India Police Science Congress meet.

58.title: Ukrainian nationals detained at Assam's Badarpur railway station
58.article_body: Two Ukrainian nationals were detained by police at Assam's Badarpur railway station for not showing valid documents. Both Ukrainians were detained from the Agartala Firozpur Express when the police were conducting a routine check. "We have recovered some Bangladeshi currency notes, shoes, clothes and other items, four bags in possession from them," the police said.

59.title: Begged Heard to give me detox pills, lowest point of life: Depp
59.article_body: In his ongoing defamation case against his ex-wife Amber Heard, Johnny Depp revealed she denied him withdrawal medication as he tried to detox from narcotics. "That was about the lowest point in my life...because I had to say, 'Please, please, may I have the meds? Because it's really kicking in'. And she was adamant, 'No, it's not time'," he stated.

60.title: Looking forward to battle vs ex-teammates Hetmyer, Ashwin: DC's Axar
60.article_body: Ahead of DC-RR in IPL 2022, DC all-rounder Axar Patel said he's looking forward to playing against RR batter Shimron Hetmyer and spinner R Ashwin, who were part of DC squad till last year. Hetmyer and Ashwin know our tactics and we also have a clue about their strengths and weaknesses. This will be an interesting battle," he added.

61.title: Irfan tweets on India's potential to be greatest country, Mishra's 'reply' goes viral
61.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Irfan Pathan today tweeted, "My country, my beautiful country, has the potential to be the greatest country on earth. BUT..." Leg-spinner Amit Mishra's apparent reply went viral. "My country, my beautiful country, has the potential to be the greatest country on earth...only if some people realise that our constitution is the first book to be followed," wrote Mishra.

62.title: YouTube rapper MC Kurban arrested for possessing drugs worth ₹7 lakh in Goa
62.article_body: Mumbai-based Youtube rapper MC Kurban and a 29-year-old woman were arrested by Goa Police for allegedly possessing MDMA drug worth ₹7 lakh. Police said that 25-year-old rapper, also known as Kurban Shaikh, is a habitual peddler of drugs. "He tries to get into events due to his identity as a rapper and there he peddles his drugs," police said.

63.title: People's ability to judge content gone out of the window: Nawazuddin
63.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui in an interview has stated that people were exposed to world cinema in the two years of the pandemic and he expected audiences to develop the ability to judge content. He further said that considering the kind of films becoming hits these days, their ability to judge content seems to have gone out of the window.

64.title: I jumped at the opportunity: Finch on McCullum's call for joining KKR
64.article_body: KKR pacer Aaron Finch said he "jumped" at the opportunity of playing for KKR in IPL 2022 after he got a call from head coach Brendon McCullum to join the franchise as a replacement for Alex Hales. He added that he was disappointed on not being picked at mega auction. Finch has scored 65 runs from two matches so far.

65.title: We want them to be taken back to India for trial: UK PM on Nirav Modi, Mallya
65.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson, speaking about the extradition cases of fugitives Nirav Modi and Vijay Mallya, said, "I want to make it absolutely clear...we don't welcome people who want to use our legal system to evade the law in India." He added, "The UK government has ordered their extradition and...we want them to be taken back to India for trial."

66.title: My children are competitive, they should create another Vedanta: Anil Agarwal
66.article_body: Anil Agarwal, the billionaire Chairman of Vedanta Resources, said in an interview, "This company is not going to be run by my family, it will be run by the people, for the people, for the country." On being asked about the succession plan for Vedanta, he told Moneycontrol, "My children are very competitive and competent, they should create another Vedanta."

67.title: Umesh is on fire, a 5-wicket haul is just around the corner in IPL: Lee
67.article_body: Calling Umesh Yadav "evergreen", Brett Lee said the KKR pacer is "on fire" in ongoing IPL, adding he'll soon claim a fifer in the tournament ahead. "We've seen this in this IPL so far, he's bowling with some wonderful control. He's got great swing...he always gets the wicket," he added. Umesh has taken 10 wickets from seven matches so far.

68.title: Cook seen spitting on naan at a wedding; UP Police take action after video goes viral
68.article_body: A video showing a cook spitting on naan before putting them in a tandoor allegedly at a wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad has gone viral on social media. Responding to the video on Twitter, Ghaziabad Police said that police incharge of Modinagar has been directed to investigate and take necessary action in the case.

69.title: UK PM's India visit during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' historic: PM Modi
69.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that UK PM Boris Johnson's visit to India during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' (75th year of India's independence) is historic. PM Modi also held bilateral talks with UK PM Johnson and discussed ways to enhance the bilateral cooperation between both countries. Earlier in the day, UK PM thanked PM Modi for a "fantastic welcome".

70.title: 'Enough, shut up,' shouts official at mother of boy who died in UP school bus accident
70.article_body: A video shows Sub Divisional Magistrate of Modinagar, Shubhangi Shukla, screaming at the mother of a boy who died in a school bus accident on Wednesday. The mother was sitting on the ground with her husband, daughter and a few other parents. They were protesting against the school's negligence when the official screamed "Enough! Shut up!" while wagging her finger.

71.title: DC head coach Ponting to miss tonight's IPL match as family member tests COVID-19 +ve
71.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting won't be travelling with the team to the Wankhede stadium for tonight's match against Rajasthan Royals. The former Australia captain was isolated from the rest of the squad after one of his family members, staying with him at the team hotel, tested COVID-19 positive. Ponting had tested negative for the virus.

72.title: UN documents 50 'unlawful' killings in Ukraine's Bucha
72.article_body: The UN monitoring mission in Ukraine has documented the "unlawful killing" of 50 people in Bucha, including by summary execution, the UN Human Rights Office said, adding that such "wilful killings" amount to war crimes. UN investigations show Bucha is not an "isolated incident", the office added. The monitoring mission has received allegations of over 300 unlawful killings in Ukraine.

73.title: Haryana govt waives off fee for players practicing in stadiums
73.article_body: Haryana government has decided to waive off fees charged from the players coming for practice in the stadiums or sports complexes across the state, according to an official statement. Sports Minister of Haryana Sandeep Singh said, "This decision has been taken...to further accelerate Haryana's plan of developing the state as a sports hub and for...nurturing the talent of the players."

74.title: Narendra, my 'khas dost': UK PM during speech on his first visit to India
74.article_body: During a joint statement with PM Narendra Modi on his first visit to India as UK PM, Boris Johnson said, "Narendra, my khas dost (special friend)." Speaking about free-trade agreement between India and UK, Johnson said, "As the next round of talks begins here next week, we're telling our negotiators to get it done by Diwali."

75.title: Chiranjeevi, Ram Charan thank Mahesh Babu for lending his voice to 'Acharya'
75.article_body: Actors Chiranjeevi and Ram Charan took to their respective social media handles on Friday to thank Mahesh Babu for lending his voice to their upcoming film 'Acharya'. "You made Acharya even more special to me. Can't wait for...audience to experience it on big screen," Ram Charan tweeted. Directed by Koratala Siva, 'Acharya', will release on April 29 this year.

76.title: Shaw is a perfect hitter, he can make the best balls look bad: Irfan
76.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said DC opener Prithvi Shaw is a "perfect" hitter, adding that he can make the best balls look bad. "Shaw's technique is amazing. He has [a] high backlift which is very beautiful and that's how he generates such great timing. Shaw reminds me of Virender Sehwag," stated Irfan. Shaw's current IPL 2022 strike rate is 170.86.

77.title: Coaching roles can be split owing to 'demands' of game: Morgan
77.article_body: England white-ball skipper Eoin Morgan has said that the side can have different coaches for different formats owing to the "demands" of modern-day cricket. "Just the demands of the game as a whole now are huge, there is almost no break," Morgan said. The 35-year-old cricketer added, "It's such a big ask for one man to do the job."

78.title: Those travelling in private cars exempt from wearing face masks in Delhi
78.article_body: Delhi government on Friday said that the wearing of face masks is mandatory in public places, those travelling together in private four-wheelers are exempt from the rule. The UT's government had on Wednesday made face masks mandatory amid an increase in COVID-19 cases. A fine of ₹500 will be imposed on violators, except in cases of private cars.

79.title: Man jumps on track at Delhi metro station, delays Blue Line services
79.article_body: A man allegedly jumped on the track at Delhi's Tilak Nagar metro station on Friday morning, causing a delay in metro services on the Blue Line. Taking to Twitter, the DMRC said, "Delay in services from Tilak Nagar to Karol Bagh due to...passenger on track at Tilak Nagar." However, normal services resumed on the affected line after around 15 minutes.

80.title: Lucknow schedule of 'Gadar 2' wrapped, director shares post
80.article_body: Director Anil Sharma on Friday said he has completed the Lucknow schedule of his upcoming film 'Gadar 2'. "Feeling happy and satisfied," Sharma wrote while sharing a post on social media. Starring Sunny Deol, 'Gadar 2' went on floors in December 2021 in Himachal Pradesh. Now, after finishing the second schedule in Lucknow, the team will head to Indore.

81.title: No decision yet on Putin's participation in G20 summit: Russia
81.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is yet to decide on whether he'll attend the G20 Summit in Indonesia's Bali in November, his spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said on Friday. "We'll inform you about our decision as soon as it is made," Peskov told reporters. Many Western countries, including US and Canada, have opposed Putin's participation at the summit over the Ukraine invasion.

82.title: Video shows forest officials treating an elephant for parasitic worms in TN
82.article_body: IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a video on Twitter showing forest officials and vets successfully treating a sick elephant in Tamil Nadu's Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve. The elephant was in a helpless condition due to excessive parasitic worm load on her, Sahu mentioned in her tweet. She is doing well and a special team will monitor her health, Sahu added.

83.title: I live a good life, but make conscious choices: Bhumi Pednekar on Earth Day
83.article_body: On the occasion of Earth Day, Bhumi Pednekar urged people to take climate change seriously. While giving her own example, the actress added that it is not about giving up your life, but rather making environment-positive choices. "I live a good life, but...I make as many conscious...choices as I can," Bhumi said, adding there is a need for stronger policies.

84.title: Ranbir, Alia wanted to get into my WhatsApp group with Ayan, we rejected them: Johar
84.article_body: Karan Johar said he's part of WhatsApp group called 'A-list', which has a few of his friends whose name starts with 'A'. He added they discuss all the latest trailers and films. "Ranbir, Alia tried...hard to get into [it]...but we rejected them, Ayan [Mukerji] said no...stars...We might have opinions on their movies...which we don't want them to know," said Johar.

85.title: Wimbledon ban will incite hatred and intolerance: Belarus Tennis Federation
85.article_body: The Belarus Tennis Federation (BTF) has said that the decision to bar Russian and Belarusian players from this year's Wimbledon will "incite hatred and intolerance on ethnic grounds". "The BTF categorically condemns the decision of the Wimbledon organisers," the BTF said. Notably, the Wimbledon organisers had taken the decision on Wednesday over Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

86.title: Kishan has to be aggressive, shouldn't worry about responsibility: Jaffer
86.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan has to be "aggressive" and shouldn't worry about bearing the responsibility of the team's batting. "Once he gets that innings of 70-80, MI...will...post [a] target of...190-200 runs," added Jaffer. Kishan has scored 191 runs in IPL 2022 so far. He was dismissed for a golden duck in MI's match against CSK.

87.title: Singapore to remove most COVID-19 restrictions next week
87.article_body: Singapore would remove most remaining COVID-19 restrictions from April 26 amid declining virus cases, its Health Ministry said. The measures include removing limits on group sizes, allowing the full return of employees to workplaces, and dropping a requirement for vaccinated travellers to take a COVID-19 test before departing for Singapore. The country has reported over 11 lakh COVID-19 cases.

88.title: School gets ₹20 lakh water bill as teacher left tap on for 2 months in Japan
88.article_body: A Japanese school has received a water bill of $27,000 (over ₹20 lakh) after a teacher in charge of the pool maintenance left a tap running for around two months last year hoping it would prevent COVID-19 spread. As per the authorities, an estimated 4,000 tonnes of excess water was used, which could have filled the pool 11 times over.

89.title: Ayushmann, Jaideep's 'An Action Hero' to release on December 2
89.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, taking to Twitter on Friday, announced the release date of 'An Action Hero'. The forthcoming film, which also stars Jaideep Ahlawat, will release on December 2, 2022. Director Anirudh Iyer, speaking about the film's release, said, "I am happy with the outcome so far and we can't wait to show you what we have in store!"

90.title: Mark Zuckerberg only wants to talk about metaverse: Ex-Meta employee
90.article_body: A former Meta employee, who recently left the firm, has said metaverse is the "only thing" that CEO Mark Zuckerberg wants to talk about, Business Insider reported. Several current and former Meta employees said that his fixation with metaverse is becoming a point of frustration for employees. A current employee said the firm lacks a coherent strategy for metaverse.

91.title: Everyone should follow the law: Karnataka CM on loudspeaker row
91.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said in reference to the ongoing loudspeaker issue in religious places that "everyone should follow the law". "Instructions have been issued for resolving the loudspeaker issue harmoniously through holding peace committee meetings," CM Bommai said. He added, "There is a High Court order on Azaan. A circular has already been issued in accordance with that."

92.title: 3 TN school students issued notices after video shows boy verbally abusing teacher
92.article_body: Three Class 12 students of a government higher secondary school in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur district were issued notices after a video purportedly showing a student verbally abuse his Botany teacher surfaced online, officials said. The student also allegedly attempted to hit the teacher, while another encouraged him. The third student was issued a notice for bringing a cellphone to class.

93.title: DC openers are explosive but the middle order is yet to fire: Manjrekar
93.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said DC openers David Warner and Prithvi Shaw have formed an "explosive" partnership, but the middle order is yet to fire. "Shaw is matching [Warner's impact]," added Manjrekar. Talking about spinner Kuldeep Yadav who is currently IPL 2022's second highest wicket-taker, Manjrekar stated that captain Rishabh Pant has gone out of his way to support Kuldeep.

94.title: Feels good his touch is still existing: Jadeja on Dhoni's 13-ball 28* vs MI
94.article_body: Praising MS Dhoni after he hit a last-ball four to help CSK beat MI by three wickets in IPL 2022, CSK skipper Ravindra Jadeja said, "It feels very good that Dhoni is still hungry and the touch is still existing." Dhoni hit a 13-ball 28*. Jadeja also praised pacer Mukesh Choudhary, who posted 3-0-19-3. "He bowls well," he added.

95.title: Living up to our commitment: Binance on limiting services in Russia
95.article_body: World's largest cryptocurrency exchange Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao addressed the firm's decision to limit services in Russia, saying, "Binance gave its word...that we would implement any and all sanctions actions, and we are living up to that commitment." "We believe a crypto exchange should not have the power to unilaterally freeze an entire nation's user accounts," he added.

96.title: B'luru's Lalbagh bans use of digital cameras inside premises
96.article_body: Bengaluru's Lalbagh Botanical Garden has banned the use of digital cameras inside its premises, HT reported. Officials cited disturbance caused by the clicks and flashes to birds and bees as reasons for the ban. Notably, private photoshoots are already banned in the park. However, officials have reportedly made exceptions for special cases like research and professional photo and video shoots.

97.title: No water in 5-star hotel, ordered food 4 hours ago: Ankit Tiwari on video of Delhi hotel
97.article_body: Singer Ankit Tiwari has alleged harassment and misbehaviour by the staff of a Delhi hotel. "'HOTEL ROYAL PLAZA, NEW DELHI' Feeling like hostage with family...No water in 5-star hotel, we ordered food 4 hours ago..Outside food not allowed so no second option...Staff is threatening you with bouncers," Ankit tweeted. "Even children are crying for food and water," he wrote.

98.title: Fan carries poster reading 'We want online exam' during CSK-MI match, pic viral
98.article_body: A picture of a fan carrying a placard reading 'We want online exam' in the stands during CSK-MI IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Earlier, during KKR-SRH match, a fan's poster reading 'My girlfriend says me or IPL so I am here' had gone viral. CSK defeated MI by three wickets in their IPL 2022 match.

99.title: India will have eradicated poverty by 2050: India's richest person Adani
99.article_body: India will add $25 trillion to its economy by 2050, the country's richest person Gautam Adani has anticipated. "This translates to an addition of $2.5 billion to the GDP every day," said Adani, adding, "Over this period, we will have eradicated all forms of poverty." India will add $40 trillion to its stock market capitalisation by 2050, he added.

100.title: Andhra Pradesh village goes under self-imposed lockdown citing 'evil spirits'
100.article_body: Villagers of Sarubujjili Mandal village of Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district have gone into a self-imposed lockdown for two days over claims that "evil spirits" have surrounded the village. This comes after four villagers died within one month due to unknown reasons. Srikakulam SP said a police team reached the village, lifted the lockdown and provided counselling to the villagers.

101.title: Video shows Putin clutching table during meeting, Twitter users say 'he isn't well'
101.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media sparking health concerns related to Russian President Vladimir Putin. In the video, Putin could be seen tightly clutching a table during his meeting with Russian defence minister Sergei Shoigu and was also tapping his foot while being seated in a slouching posture. A Twitter user wrote, "Putin is not looking well today."

102.title: Right choice: Milind after Akshay steps down as ambassador of tobacco brand
102.article_body: Milind Soman took to Twitter to appreciate Akshay Kumar's decision to step down as the brand ambassador of an elaichi brand, which also sells tobacco. "You made the right choice, whatever the reason!" Milind wrote. Akshay on Thursday issued a statement apologising for appearing in the ad. "I promise to be extremely mindful in making my future choices," he said.

103.title: Pele discharged from hospital after colon tumour treatment, remains stable
103.article_body: Former Brazilian footballer Pele was discharged from the hospital in Sao Paulo on Thursday. According to the doctors, Pele's clinical condition is good and stable. The 81-year-old multiple-time World Cup winner was admitted to continue post-surgical treatment for a colon tumour which he had got removed through surgery in September last year.

104.title: Man dies after being stuck under hundreds of wheat sacks in Thane
104.article_body: A 40-year-old man died after being stuck under a pile of wheat sacks in a ration shop in Thane on Thursday. The deceased, who was a worker at the shop, was counting the wheat bags when around 100-125 bags slipped and fell on him, an official said. Subsequently, he was taken to a nearby hospital, but doctors declared him dead.

105.title: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire receives bomb threat via email
105.article_body: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire received a bomb threat to his home in Cheshire via email on Thursday. "No evacuations took place, but as a precautionary measure a police explosives dog attended the address...to conduct a search of the gardens and surrounding area," the police said. This comes as Maguire was recently criticised for his performance for club and country.

106.title: Taliban bans TikTok, PUBG for 'misleading youth' in Afghanistan
106.article_body:
The Taliban in Afghanistan has ordered a ban on TikTok and PUBG, saying that these platforms "mislead the younger generation". It said that it would also ban TV channels from airing 
 "immoral material". While it is unclear when the ban will come into place, this is the first time that the Taliban has banned an app since coming to power.

107.title: Nykaa buys stakes in Earth Rhythm and Nudge Wellness, acquires KICA
107.article_body: Nykaa on Friday announced that its board has approved its investments in homegrown beauty brand Earth Rhythm, nutricosmetic products maker Nudge Wellness and activewear athleisure brand KICA. Nykaa said it is acquiring up to 18.51% stake in Earth Rhythm for ₹41.65 crore and a 60% stake in Nudge Wellness for ₹3.6 crore. Further, it has acquired KICA for ₹4.51 crore.

108.title: 24 children fall ill after being administered deworming tablets at Bihar school
108.article_body: Around 24 children complained of uneasiness and nausea and some even fell unconscious after being administered deworming tablets at a school in Bihar's Munger on Friday. "The children may have taken the tablets on an empty stomach and hence they developed some uneasiness," Munger DM said. Some of the children were rushed to a primary health centre, he added.

109.title: 12-yr-old rapes and impregnates 17-yr-old TN girl; arrested after she delivers baby
109.article_body: Police in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur have arrested a 12-year-old boy for allegedly raping and impregnating a 17-year-old girl. The girl was hospitalised a few days ago after complaining of severe stomach pain and doctors informed her parents she's nine months pregnant. She delivered the baby on the same day and informed the police about the boy's involvement, police said.

110.title: Man kills wife after fight over mobile addiction in Karnataka
110.article_body: A man in Karnataka's Kaveripura village allegedly killed his 31-year-old wife after a fight over her mobile addiction. The accused told police he slapped her after finding her talking to someone else on phone, following which the woman attacked him with a log of wood. During the fight, when she fell, he strangled her and ran away, the man confessed.

111.title: What records did Dhoni, CSK break with last-ball win against MI?
111.article_body: MS Dhoni slammed 28*(13) to help CSK defeat MI on last ball. Dhoni recorded a strike rate of 215.38, the highest by any CSK batter in IPL 2022. Dhoni became the first player to chase down 15-plus runs in last over in IPL three times. CSK won an IPL match on last ball while chasing for a record eighth time.

112.title: Amarinder Singh Raja takes charge as Punjab Congress chief
112.article_body: Congress leader Amarinder Singh Raja on Friday took charge as Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee President. "Discipline, dedication and dialogue will be my 3-D mantra for working for and strengthening the party," he tweeted. "I hope the mistakes of the past will not be repeated now. There is a need to reinvent Congress," former Punjab Congress president Navjot Singh Sidhu said.

113.title: Bond producers Barbara Broccoli, Michael Wilson to receive 2022 Pioneers Award
113.article_body: 'James Bond' producers Michael G Wilson and Barbara Broccoli will be honoured with the 2022 Pioneer of the Year Award. Broccoli and her half brother Wilson, have produced nine of the 25 Bond films since taking over leadership of the London-based Eon Productions. According to Hollywood Reporter, the duo will receive the honour at Beverly Hilton on September 21.

114.title: 'Nil Battey Sannata' changed my life: Swara on film's 6th anniversary
114.article_body: Swara Bhasker on Friday shared a post on her Twitter handle marking the sixth anniversary of her film 'Nil Battey Sannata'. "Six years to this gem that changed my life! To a role that made me a better person," she wrote, adding, "These are the films and parts that make you feel blessed and make all those struggling days worthwhile."

115.title: US warns Europe to be ‘careful’ with Russian oil ban
115.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Europe should be "careful" about imposing an outright ban on Russian oil. Europe "clearly needs to reduce its dependence on Russia with respect to energy" but an immediate ban by the EU would "clearly raise global oil prices" and "would have a damaging impact on Europe and other parts of the world", she added.

116.title: B'luru-based doctor features in The Ophthalmologist Power List 2022
116.article_body: Bengaluru-based cornea-refractive surgeon and a clinician scientist Dr Rohit Shetty has been named as one of the Top 100 most influential ophthalmologists in the world by The Ophthalmologist magazine. The Ophthalmologist Power List 2022 includes "genuine giants of clinical practice and vision research". Shetty said, "I am humbled and honoured to be amongst the top brilliant minds in eye care."

117.title: Actor Amit Sadh dating British actress Vivien Monory: Report
117.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh, known for films like 'Kai po che!', 'Sultan' and 'Super 30', is dating British actress Vivien Monory, according to Hindustan Times. "The couple went on a trip in November last year. Sadh also travelled to celebrate Monory's 26th birthday in February," the report said. Vivien Monory was a part of actor Liam Neeson's 2019 film 'Ordinary Love'.

118.title: Thailand to drop on-arrival COVID-19 tests for vaccinated tourists
118.article_body:
Thailand on Friday announced that vaccinated tourists arriving in the country will no longer have to undergo a COVID-19 test from May 1. Authorities will now only require arrivals to show proof of vaccination and health insurance coverage of at least $10,000, officials said. This comes after 
Thailand dropped the requirement for mandatory pre-arrival COVID-19 tests in March.

119.title: Arunachal Pradesh CM performs traditional dance at Bihu festival
119.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu joined the Assamese community of Itanagar to celebrate the Bihu festival at his residence and performed a traditional dance with them. Tweeting a video of the same on Friday, Khandu wrote, "May such spirit of celebration re-kindling age-old cultural bond between Arunachal and Assam continue to thrive forever!"

120.title: 'Danda-based' policing is over, police need to be tech-savvy now: Amit Shah
120.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that we have to change the science of policing now. "The time of British era 'danda-based' policing is over. Now, it's imperative that policing is done on the basis of knowledge, evidence and logic," he added. "Police need to stay two steps ahead of criminals, they have to become tech-savvy," he further said.

121.title: Indian Idol 12 contestant accused of scamming, she says, 'Account was hacked'
121.article_body: Indian Idol 12 contestant Anjali Gaikwad has been accused by a social media influencer Harami Parindey of trying to cheat him of his money on Instagram. Meanwhile, 16-year-old Anjali said her Instagram account had been hacked around 20 days ago and the hacker asked for a ransom of ₹70,000 from her. She claimed she had reported the matter to cybercrime.

122.title: Rakhi calls her look 'tribal' in video, FIR filed after complaint over 'semi-nude' outfit
122.article_body: An FIR has been filed against reality TV star Rakhi Sawant for allegedly making fun of the tribal community while wearing a 'semi-nude' outfit in a video. A complaint was filed by Jharkhand's Kendriya Sarna Samiti on Rakhi's now-deleted video where she claimed to showcase "complete tribal looks". She later apologised saying she didn't mean to hurt anyone.

123.title: Video shows guests stuck in lift after fire at Delhi wedding hall; saved after cutting roof
123.article_body: Four guests trapped inside an elevator after a fire broke out at a wedding hall in Outer Delhi's GT Karnal Road were rescued by firefighters. A video of the incident showed the firemen cutting the roof of the lift and using a ladder for rescue. "We received a call around 12.45 am and rushed to the spot," DFS chief said.

124.title: Same was said about H'wood: Ajay on B'wood feeling threatened by South
124.article_body: Speaking about Bollywood being threatened by the South film industry, actor Ajay Devgn stated that the same thing was said about Hollywood some time ago but nothing happened. "More importantly, it's important to stop seeing our films from different regions like the North or South or some other place and just see them as movies from India," the actor added.

125.title: Boult gave approximately 20 runs/over vs KKR, not a reputed IPL bowler: Manjrekar
125.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said he does not consider RR pacer Trent Boult as a "reputed" IPL bowler, as he conceded "approximately 20 runs an over" in RR's win against KKR. "The game-changing or the reliable bowlers within their ranks are the spinners," added Manjrekar. "Yuzvendra Chahal [is] taking wickets and Ravichandran Ashwin [is] proving economical," stated Manjrekar.

126.title: The way the match was poised, only Dhoni could have won it: Ajay Jadeja
126.article_body: Discussing CSK's win by three wickets against MI, ex-India player Ajay Jadeja said, "The way the match was poised with four overs remaining, only MS Dhoni could have won this for them." CSK needed 48 runs in 24 balls with four wickets in hand. Dhoni scored 17 runs in the final over and remained unbeaten on 28 off 13 balls.

127.title: Large number of fish found dead at Mumbai's Banganga Tank due to water pollution
127.article_body: A large number of fish was found dead at the Banganga Tank in Mumbai's Walkeshwar Temple premises due to water pollution. "The dying of fish in the pond is an annual affair in September due to the festivals. However, this year, the fishes have died in April, which was quite shocking for us," a local environmentalist said.

128.title: Hrithik calls rumoured girlfriend Saba 'finest actor' he has seen
128.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan on Friday took to Instagram Stories to praise web series 'Rocket Boys' writing, "Repeat watch! So much to learn from this one...Makes one proud to know it's made in India by one of us." He further praised his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad, writing, "You are one of the finest actors I have ever seen. You inspire me."

129.title: Daughter Roohi's addicted to her own videos, she's a megalomaniac: Karan
129.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has revealed that his five-year-old daughter Roohi has become addicted to her own videos, adding that it is quite strange and hilarious. "Now she goes to YouTube and types Roohi Johar and she pops out and she is just staring at it. I think she has become a bit of a megalomaniac," Karan added.

130.title: CSK were under pressure till the last over but Dhoni got them home: Rohit
130.article_body: Discussing MI's last-ball defeat against CSK, MI captain Rohit Sharma said, "[We gave] a great fight. We were right in the game...But...we...know how calming MS Dhoni can be and he [got] them home." "Till the last over [CSK were] under pressure," added Rohit. MI are now the first team to lose their opening seven matches in an IPL season.

131.title: He showed the world he's still here: Jadeja on Dhoni's 13-ball 28* vs MI
131.article_body: Reacting to MS Dhoni's unbeaten 28 off 13 balls in CSK's win by three wickets against MI, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said, "We were very tense...but...we knew that the great finisher...can definitely finish the match." "Dhoni showed the world that he is still here," added Jadeja. CSK chased down the target of 156 on the last ball.

132.title: British-era Carnac Bridge in Mumbai to be demolished before monsoon season
132.article_body: The Central Railway has sought permission from traffic police to carry out demolition of the 150-year-old British-era Carnac Bridge in Mumbai, before the onset of monsoon. The bridge has been declared "unsafe" by an audit conducted by IIT Bombay in 2018. Only Light Motor Vehicle were allowed to operate on the bridge which connects P D'Mello Road and DN Road.

133.title: Every member brings an 'X-factor': Mrunal on working with Shahid's family
133.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, in a recent interview, shared her experience of working with every member of Shahid Kapoor's family. Calling the entire family talented, Mrunal said that everybody brings some 'X-factor' to the table. "I learnt to surrender myself to the director from Pankaj Sir. From Supriya Ji, I learnt how to speak with your eyes," the actress said.

134.title: Karthik has been 99% correct in anticipating a bowler's move: Shastri
134.article_body: Sharing his opinion on RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Karthik is anticipating what the bowler's doing and...the anticipation is...dead right 99 percent of the times." "That makes a difference. You are outsmarting the bowler when you are one step ahead of him," added Shastri. Karthik currently has a strike rate of 205.88 in IPL 2022.

135.title: MS Dhoni is the greatest last over hitter of all time: Michael Vaughan
135.article_body: Reacting to MS Dhoni scoring 16 runs off the final four deliveries to help CSK defeat MI by three wickets, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan tweeted, "[Dhoni is] the greatest last over hitter of all time." "You are no more just a finisher, you are the GOAT (Greatest of All Time) of finishers," read a tweet from ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth.

136.title: Dismissing AB de Villiers was my 'ultimate' goal: Dale Steyn
136.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn said he felt great dismissing West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell, but dismissing former South Africa cricketer AB de Villiers was his "ultimate goal". "When I walked back into the South African team, [AB respected me]...[because] I got him out," added Steyn. Steyn and De Villiers faced off against each other in the IPL.

137.title: Tesla was a shell corp with no staff, no IP before I acquired it: Musk
137.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to GrowthSchool's Vaibhav Sisinty, who "reminded" users of Musk's Tesla acquisition, said, "It was a shell corp with no employees, no IP, no designs, no prototype, literally nothing." He added, if filing a shell corp constitutes 'founding a company', then he would be PayPal's only founder. Sisinty had highlighted that Musk isn't Tesla's founder.

138.title: Maha govt to import coal to tide over load shedding crisis: Ajit Pawar
138.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Friday said that the state government is going to import coal "to some extent" from outside the country in order to tide over the current load shedding crisis in the state. "Efforts are being made to get one coal mine allocated for Maharashtra State Power Generation Company Limited," Pawar added.

139.title: Mann is an honest man: Sidhu after calling him a 'rubber doll'
139.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Friday praised Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, saying that he is an "honest man" and he considers the latter his younger brother. This comes a day after Sidhu called Mann a "rubber doll" controlled by Delhi. "I've never raised a finger at [Mann]. If he fights against [mafia] my support is with him," Sidhu added.

140.title: Apple asked to pay $1,000 to man for selling iPhone without charger in Brazil
140.article_body: A Brazilian court has ordered Apple to pay a compensation of about $1,000 to a customer who made a complaint about not getting a charger with his iPhone. The judge ruled that Apple is engaged in "abusive and illegal" practice by selling new iPhones without power adapters and that the latter is quite essential for the functioning of the iPhone.

141.title: Shining a light on our wondrous planet: NASA as it shares pics of Earth
141.article_body: NASA took to its official Instagram page to share pictures of Earth and wrote in the caption, "We're shining a light on our wondrous planet." It further revealed that the pictures are of Malaspina Glacier in Alaska, Lake Carnegie in Australia, Ugab in Namibia, Jau National Park in Brazil and Sahara Desert in Chad.

142.title: Nani calls Shahid Kapoor's 'Jersey' true good cinema, actor responds
142.article_body: Telugu actor Nani on Friday praised Shahid Kapoor-starrer 'Jersey' on Twitter calling it "true good cinema". The actor wrote, "What performances and heart...Congratulations." Shahid responded to Nani's tweet, writing, "Thank you. From one Arjun to another...You have a big heart and that's what 'Jersey' is all about." The film is a remake of 2019 Telugu film 'Jersey' which starred Nani.

143.title: Time-lapse satellite pics of melting glaciers, deforestation shared by Google
143.article_body: To mark the Earth Day, Google Doodle has shared time-lapse satellite images showing melting glaciers, retreating snow cover, deforestation and coral bleaching. It is created from real imagery from Glacier retreat at the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro in Africa, Sermersooq Glacier retreat in  Greenland, Great Barrier Reef in Australia and Harz Forests in Germany.

144.title: Kangana has strong views, sometimes I don't agree with them: Ekta
144.article_body: Producer Ekta Kapoor has said that actress Kangana Ranaut has pretty strong points of view which rattles a lot of people, adding even she doesn't agree with them sometimes. "She's...a clutter-breaker...I've known her to be pretty non-biased...She won't go on a show and say...'I don't get along with this guy...so I'm not gonna like him on the show'," Ekta added.

145.title: MSEDCL restores power at woman's house after 49 days in Pune
145.article_body: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited yesterday restored power at Aparna Karmarkar's two-storey bungalow in Pune after 49 days. According to Karmarkar, the power supply at her bungalow was disrupted since March 3. She alleged the lineman visited her place multiple times but didn't do any work. MSEDCL said, "The property was locked...that's why it took time to restore power."

146.title: 3 killed, 34 injured as wall and balcony of wedding venue collapses in UP
146.article_body: Three persons were killed when the balcony and wall of a house collapsed during a wedding ceremony in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. At least 34 other persons, who sustained injuries in the incident, were admitted to nearby hospitals. The incident took place at the house after the guests welcomed a wedding procession that had arrived from another village.

147.title: It'll turn around: Head coach Jayawardena after MI's 7th loss in a row
147.article_body: MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said that things will turn around following the team's seventh straight loss in IPL 2022. "You need to back the ability and give them confidence. These are guys who have played a lot of IPL games and understand what needs to be done," he added. MI lost to CSK by three wickets on Thursday.

148.title: SP should have helped Azam Khan: Shivpal after meeting him in jail
148.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party Lohia (PSPL) leader Shivpal Singh Yadav met SP leader Azam Khan in Sitapur jail on Friday. Soon after his meeting, he said, "If SP, under the leadership of Mulayam Singh Yadav, had raised the issue of Khan in Parliament, then PM Narendra Modi, who has immense respect for the SP patriarch, would have listened."

149.title: Family's car taken away by officials for Andhra CM's convoy; family stranded on road
149.article_body: A family's car was taken away by a home guard and an assistant motor vehicle inspector in Andhra Pradesh, saying that the vehicle was required for the convoy of the Chief Minister. The car was seized after the family stopped the vehicle at a roadside hotel. A picture showed the family stranded on road.

150.title: Man stabs father to death for waking him up early in morning in MP
150.article_body: A man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed his 65-year-old father to death for waking him up early in the morning in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri, police said on Friday. The accused claimed that he got very tired after work and wanted to complete his sleep. The accused reportedly slit his father's throat and attacked him multiple times.

151.title: KGF makers team up with Sudha Kongara for film based on true events
151.article_body: Hombale Films, the production house behind the 'K.G.F' franchise, on Thursday announced a film with filmmaker Sudha Kongara, who's known for directing 'Soorarai Pottru'. "Some true stories deserve to be told, and told right," Hombale Films wrote on Twitter while announcing the film. Sudha is also working on the Hindi remake of 'Soorarai Pottru', which stars Akshay Kumar.

152.title: Family stages protest after death of Class 3 student in Ghaziabad
152.article_body: The family members of the Class 3 student, who died after his head hit a pole while he was peeping out of the school bus window in Ghaziabad, protested outside a police station. They demanded the immediate arrest of the school officials. Police said they've arrested the bus driver and the conductor, adding, "If we find [school officials'] role...we'll take...action."

153.title: Russia wants to free up troops by not storming Mariupol steel plant: UK
153.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's decision to blockade the Azovstal steel plant "likely indicates a desire to contain Ukrainian resistance in Mariupol and free up Russian forces to be deployed elsewhere in eastern Ukraine", UK's Defence Ministry said. Storming the plant "would likely incur significant Russian casualties", further decreasing their [Russia's] overall combat effectiveness, it added.

154.title: 5 held for man's death during Ram Navami procession in MP's Khargone
154.article_body: As many as five people have been arrested in connection with a 30-year-old man's death during the Ram Navami procession on April 10 in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, police said. The victim, a municipal employee, had been missing since the April 10 violence. His body was found eight days later at a morgue in Indore, police had said earlier.

155.title: Start filling B'luru potholes immediately: K'taka HC to contractor
155.article_body: Karnataka High Court has directed a contractor, American Road Technology and Solutions Private Limited, to start filling potholes in the city "immediately" as per BBMP's order. The contractor had sought that the BBMP pay PWD rates and reportedly make an advance payment. The court asked the BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta to consider the same and take appropriate action.

156.title: I tried to have my cake & eat it too, failed: Musk on starting Tesla, SpaceX together
156.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "My true moral error was creating Tesla and SpaceX at same time." He said that he avoided general management-related work at the electric vehicle maker Tesla and focused only on product and engineering. "Tried to have my cake and eat it too, which failed," Musk, who is currently the world's richest person, added.

157.title: 2 kill man for not printing their pics in hoardings in Pune; held
157.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly attacking a man with an iron hammer, leading to his death, in a dispute over not printing the duo's pictures on hoardings on the occasion of Ambedkar Jayanti in Pune. The accused had attacked the man and his friend on April 19. The man had succumbed to his injuries on Thursday at a hospital.

158.title: PMPML contractors go on strike today, over 700 buses go off road in Pune
158.article_body: The private buses contractors of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) have called for a strike today due to some payment issues with the transport authority. The strike has meant that out of around 1,500 buses owned by the PMPML, over 700 are not available for commuters today in Pune. However, the protesting contractors are served with notices, officials said.

159.title: Social media's design is tilting us in the wrong direction: Obama
159.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama, while discussing social media platforms and disinformation at a conference, said, "The very design of these platforms is tilting us in the wrong direction." He warned that citizens no longer know "what to believe" due to false information spreading online. "Disinformation is a threat to our democracy," Obama said.

160.title: Saliva laced with gutkha corroding Howrah Bridge: IAS officer to Ajay, SRK as he shares pic
160.article_body: Amid controversy over gutkha brand endorsements, IAS officer Awanish Sharan tweeted, "Kolkata Port Trust has said saliva laced with gutkha is corroding the iconic 70-year-old bridge. The Howrah Bridge is under attack from gutkha-chewers." He also shared a picture of a bridge pillar soiled with gutkha-laced spit and tagged actors Ajay Devgn, Shah Rukh Khan, Akshay Kumar and Amitabh Bachchan.

161.title: We lost a baby via surrogacy, reveals actress Amrita Rao
161.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao and her husband RJ Anmol, while sharing their pregnancy struggle, revealed they tried many methods to embrace parenthood. They revealed they had opted for surrogacy but a few days later, they were informed the baby was no more. "Aspiring parents, I don't think you need to be so emotional. This is not in our hands," Amrita stated.

162.title: IPL share video of Dhoni smashing 16 runs off last 4 balls to finish the run chase
162.article_body: IPL shared a video of CSK's MS Dhoni finishing the run chase against MI by smashing 16 runs off the last four deliveries. Dhoni slammed a six on the third ball of last over bowled by Jaydev Unadkat, followed by a four, a double and a four. "Final over finesse: An MS Dhoni masterclass seals it for CSK," IPL wrote.

163.title: Govt may cut LIC IPO size by 40% as it looks to raise ₹30,000 crore: Report
163.article_body: The government is looking to raise ₹30,000 crore through the initial public offering (IPO) of state-run Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC), Bloomberg reported. This is about 40% lower than the previous estimates of over ₹50,000 crore. However, it is still poised to be India's biggest IPO to date. As per reports, LIC will be valued at ₹6 lakh crore.

164.title: Bride, caterer arrested for lacing wedding food with marijuana in US
164.article_body: A bride and her wedding caterer have been arrested for allegedly serving marijuana-laced food at her February wedding as a prank in US' Florida, local media reported. Police had reportedly arrived at the wedding venue after several guests called emergency services feeling unwell. The duo has been charged with negligence, delivery of marijuana, and violating state laws against food tampering.

165.title: Ex-WWE stars Karrion Kross and Scarlett get married on top of glacier, share video
165.article_body: Former WWE stars Karrion Kross and Scarlett Bordeaux tie the knot on top of a glacier in Alaska. The duo took to their respective Instagram accounts to share pictures and video from the ceremony. "We flew to Alaska, hopped on a helicopter and flew to a glacier for a very private ceremony (then wrestled the next day, naturally)," wrote Kross.

166.title: Ranbir & Rashmika Mandanna's 'Animal' goes on floors in Manali
166.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Rashmika Mandanna-starrer 'Animal' went on the floors in Manali on Friday. The upcoming action film, directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga of 'Kabir Singh' fame, will also feature Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol among others in pivotal roles. Backed by Bhushan Kumar and Pranay Reddy Vanga, 'Animal' is expected to release in theatres on August 11, 2023.

167.title: Ukraine Vice PM shares 'facepalm' emoji on Russia banning Zuckerberg
167.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov, on Twitter, shared a 'facepalm' emoji while saying that Russia had imposed sanctions on Mark Zuckerberg. Russia has banned 29 Americans, including Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, from entering Russia. Earlier, Russia had protested against Meta allowing users in some countries to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers over the Ukraine war.

168.title: I have the Indian jab in my arm: UK PM on taking Covishield vaccine
168.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson, who's on a two-day visit to India, on Friday revealed that he has taken the Covishield COVID-19 vaccine manufactured by the Serum Institute of India. Talking about getting vaccinated with the vaccine developed by Oxford University and AstraZeneca, Johnson said, "I have the Indian jab in my arm." He added, "Many thanks to India."

169.title: Probe sources of properties of Jahangirpuri violence accused: Police to ED
169.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday asked Enforcement Directorate (ED) to probe the sources of properties of Ansar Sheikh, an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence. "He reportedly owns a big mansion in West Bengal...does a lot of charity for his community. We suspect he frequently receives money via shady channels," police said. "We're also looking into his links with terrorists," police added.

170.title: BJP slams Cong govt for demolishing 300-yr-old Shiva temple in Alwar
170.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Friday slammed Rajasthan's Congress government for allegedly demolishing a 300-year-old Shiva temple in Alwar as a part of an anti-encroachment drive. BJP leader Amit Malviya accused Congress of demolishing temples in the name of development. "Shedding tears on Karauli...Jahangirpuri and hurting the faith of Hindus - this is the secularism of Congress," he tweeted.

171.title: 18 more test COVID-19 +ve at IIT Madras, total cases now at 30
171.article_body: At least 18 more students tested positive for coronavirus on Friday at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras, which is located in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The total number of positive cases in the institute has now risen to 30. This comes as India saw a rise in coronavirus cases for the third day in a row with 2,451 cases.

172.title: Tamil Nadu makes face masks mandatory again; violators to be fined ₹500
172.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Friday issued an order making face masks at public places mandatory again. According to the order issued by the state Health Department, a fine of ₹500 will be imposed on violators. The department said the decision was taken in view of the rising COVID-19 cases across the country, especially in Delhi.

173.title: Rider was overspeeding, nothing wrong with scooter: Ola on Guwahati accident
173.article_body: Ola Electric issued a statement with a graph that showed the speed data of the scooter that was involved in an accident in which the owner alleged that his son sustained injuries due to the faulty vehicle in Guwahati. It said, "the rider was overspeeding...He braked in panic, thereby losing control of the vehicle. There's nothing wrong with the vehicle."

174.title: Will take serious view of demolitions in Jahangirpuri that took place after our order: SC
174.article_body: In the Jahangirpuri demolition matter, the Supreme Court on Thursday said, "Will take a serious view of all demolitions that took place after our status quo decision was communicated to the mayor." The demolition, which started around 10.15 am, went on for two hours despite the Supreme Court's directions at 11 am that status quo be maintained.

175.title: Filmmaking is tougher now, everyone is a critic: Ajay Devgn
175.article_body: Ajay Devgn in a recent interview said it is tough to make a film now as compared to the 90s.
