"Earlier, filmmaking was a lot of fun...There was no pressure of whether the film will work or not," the actor said adding, "Now, everyone is a critic." Ajay further said that international exposure has made the industry quality conscious.

176.title: GB Nagar Police takes action against 17 DJ operators for violating norms
176.article_body: The GB Nagar Police seized the vehicles of 17 DJ operators, who were found violating noise pollution norms in the district. Despite serving notices about the permitted decibel levels to control noise pollution, the DJ operators continued to play loud music, the police said. The police is also issuing notices to religious places, marriage halls to control sound limit.

177.title: More funding needed to roll out malaria vaccine, warns Oxford chief
177.article_body: More government funding is needed to roll out the world's most effective malaria vaccine in Africa, where malaria is the leading cause of death in children and infants, Oxford's Professor Hill, who developed the jab, warned. "It seems extraordinary...that we can't find the money to get Africa out of the horrendous mortality that it's been suffering for decades," he said.

178.title: I felt like Sachin Tendulkar, Amitabh Bachchan: UK PM on India welcome
178.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who is in India on a two-day visit, said, "I thank PM Narendra Modi and the people of India for the grand welcome. I felt like Sachin Tendulkar upon my arrival and also like Amitabh Bachchan when I saw hoardings everywhere." Today, Johnson held talks on UK and India's strategic defence, diplomatic and economic partnership.

179.title: Sachin said 'Don't be afraid of failure, just be yourself': Kishan
179.article_body: Recalling his conversation with Sachin Tendulkar after MI's loss against LSG, MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said, "He just told me to be myself...There should be no fear of failure." Kishan scored 13 runs off 17 balls against LSG. He was dismissed for a golden duck against CSK. Kishan has scored 191 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

180.title: 35-year-old man shot dead by bike-borne assailant in Gurugram
180.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly shot dead by a bike-borne assailant in Gurugram's Bilaspur Khurd village. According to police, the deceased, identified as Deepak, was present outside a house he had put on rent when he was fired upon. The accused then tried to flee, however, he was caught by Deepak's cousin brothers who handed him over to the police.

181.title: Hardik takes the bull by its horns, he is IPL 2022's best captain so far: Hogg
181.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said GT captain Hardik Pandya has been IPL 2022's best captain so far, adding that he won't be "surprised" if Hardik leads India in white-ball cricket "in two years". "Hardik takes the bull by its horns...He will [take]...the ball when the game is on the line and he is up against the best batter," stated Hogg.

182.title: Lives of 1 lakh trapped civilians in Mariupol are in Putin's hands: Mayor
182.article_body: The lives of about 1,00,000 civilians still trapped in Ukraine's war-torn Mariupol are in Russian President Vladimir Putin's hands, the city's Mayor Vadym Boichenko told Reuters. He added that satellite images released of a mass grave site by US company Maxar Technologies near Mariupol were proof that Russian forces were burying bodies to try to hide the death toll.

183.title: 14-yr-old boy dead, minor friend critical after accident while riding bike in Thane
183.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died and his 16-year-old friend was left critically injured after the motorbike they were riding was hit by an unidentified vehicle on Vanjarpatti flyover in Thane's Bhiwandi. "We'll find out who the bike's owner is and take appropriate action against the person, as it's against the law to give your vehicle to minors," a police officer said.

184.title: B'luru teen makes platform to support COVID-19 affected women
184.article_body: A 17-year-old girl, Anika Midha, has built non-profit organisation Willow Fund to help support women affected by COVID-19 and showcase work by women artisans from rural areas. "I used my sense of resilience to dream of...better future for women artisans," Midha said. Furthermore, Willow Fund provided financial support to two engineering students who lost primary earning family members to COVID-19.

185.title: Several cheated of ₹12 crore via bogus Pune poultry firm website, YouTube channel
185.article_body: A case has been lodged against cyber fraudsters for allegedly cheating several investors of over ₹12 crore by creating a bogus website and YouTube channel using a Pune-based leading poultry firm's name and logo. Police said the fraudsters posted a fake advertisement regarding an investment scheme and appealed to people to invest money after promising them lucrative financial returns.

186.title: Over 50 houses, shops gutted in fire in Arunachal Pradesh
186.article_body: More than 50 houses and shops were gutted after a fire broke out in Yingkiong's upper market area in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang on Thursday, state Health Minister Alo Libang said. "Properties worth around ₹4 crore have been damaged as being assessed by the district administration," he added. The fire affected about 120 to 175 people, Libang stated.

187.title: Ranbir, Alia wanted to get into 'A-list' WhatsApp group, we rejected them: Johar
187.article_body: Karan Johar said he's part of WhatsApp group called 'A-list', which has a few of his friends whose name starts with 'A'. He added they discuss all the latest trailers and films. "Ranbir, Alia tried...hard to get into [it]...but we rejected them, Ayan [Mukerji] said no...stars...We might have opinions on their movies...which we don't want them to know," said Johar.

188.title: Over 6 cr members enrol for Cong's internal polls to elect new president
188.article_body: Over six crore Congress members have enrolled themselves to participate in the party's organisational elections, Congress Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said. "Around 2.6 crore members were enrolled through digital membership. Membership has been done through papers too," he said. The party will get a new president by the end of September 2022, Mistry further said.

189.title: What are RBI's new guidelines for credit and debit cards effective from July 1?
189.article_body: Among the various guidelines, some include no hidden charges on a credit card issued free of charge. While banks won't force customers to avail debit cards, any changes in credit card charges shall be intimated to the users 30 days prior to their implementation. Notably, reasons for rejecting credit card applications shall be given in writing to the user.

190.title: No power born in India to divide country: Salman Khurshid
190.article_body: Senior Congress leader Salman Khurshid has said that "no power has been born to divide the country of India". "My opinion is clear...A few people can confuse the public but the soul of the country cannot be broken because there is no force to break India," Khurshid said. "This belief should never be allowed to get hurt," he added.

191.title: I've faced a lot of rejections: Ramayan actor Sunil's son on star-kid tag
191.article_body: Actor Krish Pathak, son of 'Ramayan' actor Sunil Lahri, said in an interview that he never saw himself as a 'star-kid'. "I have had a lot of struggles and rejections but I never took those rejections seriously," he added. Krish further said he doesn't believe that he will get anything on a platter because of his father.

192.title: US man dies of brain infection after contracting rare virus spread by ticks
192.article_body: A man in Maine, US died after suffering a brain infection from the rare Powassan virus that he contracted from tick bite. The virus creates a dangerous brain infecting virus that causes severe neurological symptoms. No cure, vaccine or antiviral treatment has been discovered yet to treat the virus. Experts have advised locals to take steps that prevent tick bites.

193.title: 2 Pak terrorists of JeM's suicide squad killed in Jammu: J&K DGP
193.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh said on Friday that two Pakistani terrorists of Jaish-e-Mohammed's (JeM) suicide squad were killed in Jammu's Sunjwan. This comes as terrorists attacked a bus carrying 15 CISF personnel there and one ASI lost his life. "This is part of...larger conspiracy to disturb peace in Jammu and sabotage [PM Narendra Modi's] visit," Singh added.

194.title: Turkey's Oppn leader left without electricity after refusing to pay bills
194.article_body: The leader of Turkey's main opposition party, who has refused to pay his electricity bills in protest of high household energy prices, said authorities have cut off the power supply to his home on Thursday. "Energy is a basic human right. It's like bread...water...[and] air," Kemal Kilicdaroglu said, adding, "I wanted to be the voice of those who cannot pay."

195.title: Temple-like structure found during mosque renovation in Mangaluru
195.article_body: A temple-like architectural design has been discovered underneath an old mosque in Mangaluru's Malali. The structure was identified when the renovation work at Juma Masjid was underway. "The District administration is looking into the old land records and entries regarding the ownership details. We will take reports from endowment department and Waqf Board," Deputy Commissioner Rajendra KV said.

196.title: Man killed in celebratory firing at a wedding in Lakhimpur Kheri
196.article_body: A man was killed during a celebratory gun firing at a wedding ceremony in the Naurangabad village of Lakhimpur Kheri, Uttar Pradesh. According to the police, the deceased was shot in his stomach while dancing and was immediately taken to the nearby district hospital where the doctors referred him to Lucknow. The deceased succumbed to his injuries on the way.

197.title: Scientists breed US coral species under threat by new disease
197.article_body: Scientists of the Florida Coral Rescue Center have successfully bred the rough cactus coral species off the coast of Florida that is under threat by a relatively new disease. The disease, called Stony Coral Tissue Loss Disease, takes away corals' colour and ultimately its life altogether. The centre has bred hundreds of rough cactus coral at a 2,000-square-foot facility.

198.title: Umar Khalid's Amravati speech was offensive and hateful: Delhi HC
198.article_body: Umar Khalid's speech at Amravati in February 2020 in connection with the larger conspiracy case related to the Northeast Delhi riots was offensive and hateful, Delhi High Court said. "These expressions being used, don't you think they incite people?" HC added. Delhi HC was hearing Khalid's appeal against the dismissal of his bail plea by a lower court.

199.title: Jharkhand HC grants bail to RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in fodder scam case
199.article_body: Jharkhand High Court on Friday granted bail to Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in the ₹139.35-crore Doranda Treasury case, the fifth case against him in connection with the fodder scam. "We had pleaded that he has served half of his five-year sentence in this case,"  Yadav's counsel said. "CBI opposed the plea...HC granted bail," the counsel added.

200.title: Raj Kundra wears dress completely covering his face, gets trolled after video goes viral
200.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra has been trolled after he was seen wearing a dress completely covering his face in a viral video. Commenting on the video, social media users wrote, "People like him have no option other than hiding face," and "He is looking like Jaadu from Koi... Mil Gaya." He was seen wearing a similar attire in March.

201.title: Benched by DC in every IPL match so far, Sakariya shares excerpt from Anderson's book
201.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya, who's yet to play an IPL 2022 match, shared an excerpt from England pacer James Anderson's book. In the excerpt, Anderson talked about how he wanted to go back from Caribbean and play county after not getting a match in T20 World Cup 2010. "Painful experience has taught me there's nothing worse than...[net bowling]," Anderson wrote.

202.title: Saini was silent like in graveyard, said '300 runs should be enough': Ashwin on KKR match
202.article_body: Recalling the dugout atmosphere during their innings against KKR, RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin revealed Navdeep Saini asked him what a safe total should be. "[I said 230...after which] Saini...was silent like in graveyard...He said, 'Bhaiya, I was having...deep contemplation and I think 300 should really be enough'," Ashwin added. Ashwin further said that he made them "burst into laughter".

203.title: TN govt to grant 270-day leave to women staff having children via surrogacy
203.article_body: Tamil Nadu Minister for Social Welfare and Women Empowerment P Geetha Jeevan announced in the Assembly that women government employees and teachers, who have children via surrogacy, will be provided a 'child maintenance leave' for 270 days. "This is to help women government employees to take care of newborns delivered through surrogacy," the minister added.

204.title: 2 K'taka hijab case petitioners not allowed to take exam wearing burqas
204.article_body: Two petitioners in the hijab case were on Friday not allowed to take their final Class 12 board examination at Vidyodaya PU College in Karnataka's Udupi after they insisted on wearing burqas. The students reportedly tried to convince the invigilators and principal for around 45 minutes, but were refused any exception to Karnataka High Court's order upholding the hijab ban.

205.title: NITI Aayog, UNICEF India sign pact on SDGs focusing on children
205.article_body: NITI Aayog and UNICEF India have signed a statement of intent (SoI) on sustainable development goals (SDGs) with a focus on children. Together, they will work on the country's first report on multidimensional child development, focusing on health, education, sanitation and nutritional aspects. The report will also analyse recent children-related trends, a government statement said.

206.title: 4 trapped in lift rescued after fire breaks out at Delhi wedding hall
206.article_body: Four people were trapped in a lift after a fire broke out at Green Lawns Fashion Marriage Hall in Outer Delhi's GT Karnal Road on Thursday night. Delhi Fire Service personnel rescued the people including three senior citizens by cutting the upper part of the lift and pulling them out. Four fire tenders were deployed to douse the fire.

207.title: Athiya, KL Rahul to live together in ₹10 lakh/month rented house: Report
207.article_body: Actress Athiya Shetty is set to move in with her rumoured boyfriend cricketer KL Rahul in a 4BHK apartment in Mumbai, as per a report. It also stated that the rented apartment will cost ₹10 lakh per month and is located at Carter Road. The couple is said to have been dating for the last three years.

208.title: Talks on to purchase energy from pvt producers: Haryana CM on power crisis
208.article_body: The Haryana government will hold a meeting with two private players and ask them to increase power supply to meet the rise in power demand, CM Manohar Lal Khattar said. "I spoke with Adani Power on Wednesday and the issue will likely be resolved amicably," Khattar said. Haryana is facing a power shortage of 300MW-1,800MW in several areas, officials said.

209.title: 'Mad Men' actor and Emmy Award winner Robert Morse passes away at 90
209.article_body: Robert Morse, the Primetime Emmy Award-winning actor who starred in US drama 'Mad Men', passed away at the age of 90. He died peacefully at his Los Angeles home after a short illness, his agent told The Hollywood Reporter. Robert, who made his onscreen debut in 1954, appeared in over 70 projects. He was last seen in 2019 show 'Corporate'.

210.title: Biden bans Russian ships from US ports
210.article_body: US President Joe Biden said the country will ban Russian-affiliated ships from American ports over Ukraine invasion. "This is yet another critical step we're taking in concert with our partners in the European Union, the UK, and Canada and — further to deny Russia the benefits of the international economic system that they so enjoyed in the past," Biden said.

211.title: Journalist duped of ₹25,500 while ordering wine online in Mumbai
211.article_body: A 37-year-old journalist in Mumbai was duped of ₹25,500 while ordering wine online. The woman said she ordered wine on a phone number she got from Google and paid ₹400 online. The fraudster, who personated as shop employee, told her he didn't receive it and tricked her into transferring ₹25,124 from her Google Pay account on pretext of helping her.

212.title: 'Animal-like conditions' for inmates in Rohini ashram: Delhi HC
212.article_body: Hearing a petition on a Rohini-based ashram, which houses several women, the Delhi High Court said that the inmates were living in "animal-like conditions" and termed the state of affairs as "shocking". "There is a very thorough indoctrination...These women are in a trap," the court said. The bench also asked the Delhi government to consider taking over the ashram's management.

213.title: Musk in talks with Thoma Bravo to partner on Twitter offer: Report
213.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is in talks with private equity firm Thoma Bravo for partnering on a possible takeover of Twitter, as per a New York Post report. It added that Thoma Bravo could be "the key" for Musk to move forward on his offer for Twitter. Musk said he has lined up $46.5 billion in financing to acquire Twitter.

214.title: Glad we have the letters MAHI in Mahi-ndra: Anand Mahindra after MS Dhoni finishes chase
214.article_body: After MS Dhoni scored 16 runs off the last four deliveries to help CSK successfully chase down 156-run target against MI, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Well, all I can say is that I’m glad we have the letters MAHI in Mahi-ndra!" He further wrote, "Awesome finish." "And we have Anand-am in our heart," CSK replied to Anand Mahindra.

215.title: Gunshot fired at Rohini court in Delhi, 2 injured
215.article_body: A gunshot was fired at Delhi's Rohini court on Friday during a scuffle following which two persons were injured, police said. "At around 9:40 am...quarrel broke out between two advocates and a person," police added. "A NAP constable intervened...shot got fired on the ground. Two persons were injured due to concrete projectiles as a result of fire," police stated.

216.title: 3 men rape woman at hospital in Andhra on promise of marriage, job
216.article_body: Three men were arrested on Thursday for the alleged abduction and rape of a 23-year-old mentally challenged woman at Government General Hospital in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada. One accused reportedly took the woman there and raped her on the promise of marriage on Tuesday. Later, the other two accused apparently found the woman and raped her with promise of a job.

217.title: Russia has rejected proposal for Easter truce: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
217.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia rejected a proposal for a truce over the Orthodox Christian Easter period this weekend. "This shows very well how the leaders of this state actually treat the Christian faith, one of the most joyful and important holidays," Zelenskyy said. "But we keep the hope. Hope for peace, hope that life overcomes death," he added.

218.title: Burglars held in Karnataka for stealing valuables of Goa's foreign tourists
218.article_body: Goa police have arrested two persons from Karnataka for allegedly stealing the valuables of foreigners through house break-ins in Goa. According to the police, the accused duo, Lathif Khan (28) and KS Azeez (46), are alleged to be part of an inter-state gang of burglars which targets foreigners, especially in the North Goa tourist belt.

219.title: I was living a drunk life, my parents had divorced: Robinson on racist, sexist tweets
219.article_body: England fast bowler Ollie Robinson, whose racist and sexist tweets had resurfaced last year, said, "When the tweets resurfaced...I thought, 'Do I still have those views? Am I still that person?'" He added, "I was living a...drunk life back then. My parents had divorced...I was going out three or four times a week with my mates, joy-riding at night."

220.title: 2 Mumbai Police personnel booked for demanding ₹50,000 bribe to clear bail
220.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) of Navi Mumbai Unit booked an assistant police inspector (API) and a constable from Karjat police station in a bribery case. The accused police officials had allegedly demanded a bribe of ₹50,000 from a woman for helping her relatives secure bail and to not take action against other relatives wanted in a criminal case.

221.title: Army soldiers walk for 15 kms in snowfall, rescue 16 stranded civilians in J&K
221.article_body: The Indian Army has rescued 16 civilians who were stranded amid heavy snowfall at Sinthan Pass in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district. The soldiers walked for 15 kilometres on National Highway 244 in continuous snowfall and zero visibility conditions to reach the spot. The stranded civilians were brought down to Sinthan Maidan and were provided with food, shelter and medicine.

222.title: Let's drown her before burning, I'll f**k her burnt corpse: Depp in text about Heard
222.article_body: In Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actress' attorneys on Thursday presented emails and text messages that Depp sent to Heard, friends, family and associates. In a text to actor Paul Bettany in 2013, Depp wrote, "Let's drown her before we burn her. I will f**k her burnt corpse afterwards to make sure she is dead."

223.title: SC rejects Maha minister Nawab Malik's plea to release him from jail
223.article_body: Supreme Court has rejected Maharashtra minister and NCP leader Nawab Malik's plea seeking his release from jail in connection with a money laundering case registered against him. "It is too nascent a stage to interfere with the investigation," SC said. Bombay High Court had rejected Malik's interim application seeking immediate release in the case being investigated by the Enforcement Directorate.

224.title: Bacardi sues US airline over 420 missing cases of liquor worth $65,000
224.article_body: Bacardi has sued American Airlines alleging it hasn't paid the tab for around 420 cases of cognac that vanished from one of its flights last year, filings showed. The complaint said, 24 pallets containing 1,680 cases of cognac were loaded onto the flight. A Bacardi lawyer demanded that the airline pay the $65,820 that he said the bottles are worth.

225.title: Red scooter mine, not yet delivered: User on Ola CEO's video; company replies
225.article_body: Reacting to Ola CEO's dancing video to test a feature of the company's electric scooter, a Twitter user said his scooter hadn't been delivered as yet. He wrote, "The red scooter is mine which…I had paid for...on January 21…you people are keeping it there and dancing." Meanwhile, Ola Electric replied, "We’re on it and will get back to you soon."

226.title: 4 SDPI workers held in RSS leader murder case in Kerala's Palakkad
226.article_body: Kerala Police arrested four Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) workers in the RSS leader SK Srinivasan murder case in Palakkad. As many as 16 people were accused and four arrested are those who helped the killers, police added. This comes two days after police arrested three RSS workers for a Popular Front of India (PFI) leader's murder in Palakkad.

227.title: Pune civic body shuts 8 swimming pools over ₹3 crore unpaid rent
227.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has shut down eight swimming pools in the city as the contractors have not paid rent amounting to a total of over ₹3 crore for the past six years. The civic body has proposed to cancel ₹2.61 crore rent from COVID-19 lockdown period, but the remaining amount should be paid, PMC Additional Commissioner (General) Dnyaneshwar Molak said.

228.title: Nigerian drug peddler arrested in Mumbai, drugs worth ₹1 cr seized
228.article_body: A Nigerian national was arrested from Mumbai's Malad area for drug peddling, police said on Friday. Police also recovered 750 grams of MDMA worth ₹1.12 crore from the accused. According to Deputy Commissioner of Police, Vishal Yadav, police arrested the accused from Malvani area in Malad after receiving information that he would come there to sell drugs.

229.title: Punjab CM 'a rubber doll' being controlled by Delhi: Sidhu
229.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and said that Mann has become a "rubber da gudda (rubber doll)" who is being controlled by Delhi. "Punjab's CM should be 'ankhila' (a self-respecting man) who could not be pulled by strings," he added. "Someone is playing the game but someone else is dancing and speaking," he further said.

230.title: T'gana govt sanctions ₹2,679 cr for 3 super-speciality hospitals in Hyd
230.article_body: The Telangana government on Thursday sanctioned an amount of ₹2,679 crore for the construction of three super-speciality hospitals in Hyderabad. The hospitals, named Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences (TIMS), will be established at LB Nagar, Sanathnagar and Alwal. "These 3 along with TIMS Gachibowli will usher in best medicare for all," Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao tweeted.

231.title: 5 of family including 3 children burnt to death as car catches fire in Chhattisgarh
231.article_body: Five members of a family, including three children, were charred to death after a fire broke out in their car following an accident in Chhattisgarh's Rajnandgaon, according to police. Police added that the car crashed into a culvert near a Ganesh temple in Singarpur village on the Rajnandgaon-Khairagarh road. Khairagarh Sub-divisional Police Officer reached the spot after receiving information.

232.title: EC seeks documents on mining lease granted to CM Soren from J'khand govt
232.article_body: Election Commission of India sought documents on the mining lease granted to Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren from the state government. This comes after former CM Raghubar Das released documents to show that Soren obtained a lease of a 0.88-acre area in Ranchi. Soren is accused of getting the lease by misusing his position as Minister for the Department of Mines.

233.title: Delhi govt starts offering free COVID-19 booster dose for all adults
233.article_body: Delhi government began offering free booster shots of COVID-19 vaccine to all adults on Thursday. "All persons aged above 18 years and up to 59 years will now be eligible for precaution dose at government vaccination centres free of cost," the government order read. The precaution dose would also continue to be available at private centres for ₹375 (plus GST).

234.title: SoftBank may retain controlling stake in UK's Arm post IPO: Report
234.article_body: Japan's SoftBank plans to keep a controlling stake in Arm after the UK-based firm's planned initial public offering, Bloomberg reported citing sources. It will sell only a small part of its stake in the IPO, with an aim to get higher valuations for the rest of the shares in future. Arm's IPO is expected to happen in 2023.

235.title: Who are the fastest batters to score 100 runs against one bowler in IPL?
235.article_body: CSK's MS Dhoni set the record for becoming the fastest batter to reach 100 runs against a particular bowler in IPL. Dhoni crossed 100 runs against MI's Jaydev Unadkat, taking 42 deliveries. Suresh Raina and AB de Villiers had taken 47 deliveries each to reach 100 runs against Sandeep Sharma, while Kieron Pollard had taken 47 deliveries against Ravindra Jadeja.

236.title: Lifeguard helping in rescue gets dragged by ocean waves in Brazil, surfer saves him
236.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed how a surfer rescued a lifeguard at a beach in Brazil. The lifeguard had entered the water to assist in a rescue during a competition when he ended up getting dragged by the ocean current. The rescue was completed by a helicopter that airlifted the lifeguard, who had sustained injuries.

237.title: He doesn't rest, you call him at 11 am & he'll arrive at 9: Ajay on Big B
237.article_body: Ajay Devgn, who'll be seen alongside Amitabh Bachchan in 'Runway 34', spoke about the 79-year-old actor and said, "When he's on set...he doesn't go and rest." "If you tell him to please go to...van, he refuses...You call him at 11 am, he'll arrive at 9," Ajay said, adding, "At his age, to have that kind of dedication...for work is phenomenal."

238.title: Panel formed to check fire incidents in Delhi's DTC buses
238.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot appointed a six-member committee to find out the reason behind incidents of fire in the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC)-run buses. The panel will also include members from IIT Delhi and DTU. "It is considered essential to constitute a committee...to investigate...identify the root causes, review the modalities of repair and maintenance," read the order.

239.title: 'Breaking Bad' actor Aaron Paul blessed with a baby boy, shares pics
239.article_body: 'Breaking Bad' actor Aaron Paul and his wife Lauren Parsekian have been blessed with a baby boy. Sharing the news on Instagram, Aaron wrote, "My little man. Ryden Caspian Paul. So happy you are out in this world you beautiful boy you. I promise to make you proud little guy." Aaron announced that Bryan Cranston will be Ryden's godfather.

240.title: Rat found on Air India plane at Srinagar airport; flight delayed
240.article_body: A Jammu-bound Air India flight was delayed at the Srinagar airport after a rat was found on the plane, an airport official told ANI. The flight, AI-822, was delayed by over 60 minutes due to the incident. Last year, a dead bat was found mid-air on an Air India flight, due to which the flight returned back to Delhi airport.

241.title: Florida finance head praises Musk's bid, criticises Twitter's strategy
241.article_body: Florida's finance department CFO Jimmy Patronis has praised Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion Twitter bid and said the state of Florida, which holds shares in Twitter, is "very concerned" about it leaving the offer. The poison pill strategy used by Twitter "hurts our state's equity position," Patronis added. He also called himself a "rabid Elon Musk fan".

242.title: Don't think things have ever been as strong between us as they are now: UK PM in India
242.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson today thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for a "fantastic welcome" and said his India visit is a "very auspicious moment". "I don't think things have ever been as strong or as good between us as they are now," Johnson added. "I have never seen such a joyful reception," he further said.

243.title: US responds after India criticises US politician's visit to PoK, says 'her visit unofficial'
243.article_body: After India criticised US Congresswoman Ilhan Omar's visit to Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK), the US said, "It's an unofficial personal visit and it does not represent any policy change on behalf of US government." "If such a politician wishes to practise her narrow-minded politics at home that may be her business, but violating our territorial integrity...makes this ours," India had said.

244.title: Singaporean paraglider stuck in Himachal's Dhauladhar rescued
244.article_body: A Singapore-based paraglider, who was trapped in Himachal's Dhauladhar mountains at a height of 15,000 feet, was rescued on Thursday. Sumit Nurpuri was on a solo flight to Manali when he lost route due to high wind pressure and crash-landed in the mountains. His team sent a private helicopter to rescue him after Nurpuri alerted them using his SOS device.

245.title: Ex-Honduran President extradited to US to face drug charges
245.article_body: Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández was extradited to the US on Thursday, US Justice Department said. The US has charged Hernández, who governed the Central American nation until January, with alleged participation in a cocaine-importation conspiracy and related firearms offenses. Hernández was arrested at his home in Honduras' capital on February 15 at the request of US authorities.

246.title: Adani Group acquires 100% stake in marine services company Ocean Sparkle
246.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd through its subsidiary, The Adani Harbour Services Ltd, has entered into an agreement to acquire a 100% stake in Ocean Sparkle Ltd, India's leading third party marine services provider for ₹1,530 crore. Established in 1995 by a group of marine technocrats, the key activities carried out by OSL include towage, pilotage, and dredging.

247.title: People offer namaz, arrange Iftar party at Holy Cross Church in Nashik
247.article_body: Several people gathered at the Holy Cross Church in Maharashtra's Nashik to offer namaz on Thursday. They also arranged an Iftar party at the church after seeking opinion of all religious leaders, a person identified as Ajmal Khan said. "Father suggested that we arrange the Iftar party here. He also offered namaz with us," he added.

248.title: 260 kg of heroin worth ₹1,300 crore seized at Kandla port in Gujarat
248.article_body: In a joint operation, the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) have seized nearly 260 kilograms of heroin worth approximately ₹1,300 crore from a container at the Kandla port in Gujarat's Kutch district. A raid was carried out following a tip-off, which claimed heroin had been smuggled into the country via a port in Iran.

249.title: BJP old-timers in West Bengal should be given respect: Dilip Ghosh
249.article_body: Former BJP State President Dilip Ghosh has said that leaders who have been associated with the BJP for a long time in West Bengal should be given "respect" and "importance" by the party. "The party has fought for so many years with the help of a large number of dedicated and deserving leaders. They helped the party grow," Ghosh said.

250.title: Family's car taken for CM's convoy in Andhra; 2 officials suspended
250.article_body: A home guard and an assistant motor vehicle inspector from Andhra Pradesh's Ongole were suspended on Thursday after a car, that a family was travelling in, and its driver were taken away the previous night. The vehicle was taken under the pretext that it was needed for state CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy's convoy. The family was allegedly left stranded.

251.title: It's his business: Dilip Ghosh on reports of Prashant Kishor joining Cong
251.article_body: Reacting to reports of Prashant Kishor joining the Congress party, BJP leader Dilip Ghosh said, "It's his business." "He joined TMC, earlier he was in Nitish Kumar's party...Whichever party he works for, gets its membership...He will have a membership card of every party, will show the card saying I'm from your party, give me order," Ghosh added.

252.title: Section 144 imposed in Karnataka's Hubballi to continue till April 23
252.article_body: Section 144 imposed in Karnataka's Hubballi will continue till the morning of April 23, police said. The curfew was imposed after a mob pelted stones at a police station in which four policemen were injured on April 16. "We've registered 12 cases," Hubballi-Dharwad Police Commissioner Labhu Ram said. "One student in judicial custody...granted permission to write his exam," Ram added.

253.title: How has MS Dhoni performed in 20th overs in IPL history?
253.article_body: CSK's MS Dhoni scored 16 runs in the last over to help his team chase down 156-run target against MI. Dhoni has scored 643 runs in 20th overs in IPL, the most by a batter. He has slammed 51 sixes and 48 fours in 20th overs. He has aggregated the runs in 261 deliveries at a strike rate of 246.36.

254.title: Which batters have smashed most fours and sixes in 20th overs in IPL?
254.article_body: CSK's MS Dhoni has slammed the most boundaries (fours and sixes) in 20th overs in IPL. Dhoni has hit 99 boundaries (51 sixes and 48 fours). He is followed by Kieron Pollard, who has hit 59 boundaries (33 sixes and 26 fours). Rohit Sharma is on the third position, with 41 boundaries (23 sixes and 18 fours).

255.title: Kieron Pollard kisses Dwayne Bravo after he throws a ball at him, video goes viral
255.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard kissed CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo after the latter threw a ball at him in their IPL 2022 clash. After a video went viral, a fan tweeted, "These Caribbean lads are something different. [They make] any game...interesting to watch even in dull situations." Ahead of the match, a video had gone viral showing Bravo touching Pollard's feet.

256.title: Pune's Muslim community urges mosques to observe SC norms on loudspeakers
256.article_body: The Muslim community members in Pune have appealed to the mosque trustees and managements to abide by Supreme Court's guidelines on playing loudspeakers at religious places. A meeting was held to ensure that the mosque management has necessary permission in place from the District Magistrate's office for playing the 'azaan' (call for prayer), which takes place five times a day.

257.title: 2 drug peddlers get 20 years of imprisonment in Hyderabad
257.article_body: A court in Hyderabad convicted two drug peddlers for possessing and transporting cannabis in commercial quantity in Telangana's Hyderabad on Thursday and sentenced them to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment. The accused, Mohammed Ameen and Rameshwar, were arrested in January 2020  by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI). They have also been fined ₹1 lakh each.

258.title: India sees rise in COVID-19 cases for third day in a row as 2,451 people test positive
258.article_body: India saw a rise in COVID-19 cases for third day in a row as 2,451 people tested positive in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,380 COVID-19 cases and 56 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 14,241, while the death toll has risen to 5,22,116.

259.title: Cristiano Ronaldo shares 1st pic of newborn daughter after son's death
259.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to share the first picture of his newborn daughter. "We want to thank everyone for all the kind words...Your support is very important and we all felt the love...that you have for our family," he wrote. Ronaldo posted the picture three days after sharing the news that his and Georgina Rodriguez's baby boy had died.

260.title: Tamil Nadu CM announces sports city, resumption of Chennai ATP
260.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has announced several state-level sports projects including the establishment of a sports city near Chennai, arranging Beach Olympics and resuming the Chennai ATP tennis tournament. Stalin also said that a modern boxing complex will be established in north Chennai for ₹10 crore with facilities for volleyball, badminton, basketball, kabaddi, indoor games and a gym.

261.title: Amazon acquires B'luru-based social commerce startup GlowRoad
261.article_body: Amazon has acquired Bengaluru-based social commerce startup GlowRoad in an all-cash deal. GlowRoad, which is backed by venture capital fund Accel, Vertex Ventures, among others, was reportedly last valued at around $75 million. Post the deal, GlowRoad's team of around 170 employees will join Amazon and it will continue to be run as an independent unit for now.

262.title: Jignesh Mevani's bail plea rejected, sent to 3-day police custody
262.article_body: A court in Assam's Kokrajhar on Thursday rejected Gujarat's Vadgam MLA and Rashtriya Dalit Adhikar Manch Convener Jignesh Mevani's bail plea and sent him to police custody for three days. He was arrested by Assam Police on Wednesday from Gujarat's Palanpur for his alleged controversial tweets against PM Narendra Modi. "Who is he?" Assam CM had said on Thursday.

263.title: Ties 'vital' amid autocracy threat: UK PM ahead of meeting with PM Modi
263.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson said he is looking forward to meeting with his "friend" PM Narendra Modi in New Delhi today. "From climate change to energy security to defence, the partnership of our democracies is vital as the world faces growing threats from autocratic states," he added. Johnson will also hold talks with External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar.

264.title: BMC removes 94 kg nails from trees during decluttering drive in Mumbai
264.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) removed 94 kg of nails from trees as part of its decluttering drive. The civic body also removed concrete bases from about 983 trees across Mumbai in the last three days. The one-week special drive, which started on April 18, is aimed at removing concrete around trees besides red soil, posters, banners and cables.

265.title: WHO 'strongly recommends' Pfizer's COVID-19 antiviral pill Paxlovid for mild cases
265.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has "strongly recommended" the use of Pfizer's COVID-19 antiviral tablet Paxlovid for patients with milder forms of COVID-19 who were still at a high risk of hospitalisation. WHO also called it the "best therapeutic choice for high-risk patients to date". To be administered orally, Paxlovid is a combination of nirmatrelvir and ritonavir tablets.

266.title: B'luru man writes appreciation letter to police after he gets back lost money
266.article_body: A Bengaluru man who lost ₹28,600 in a cybercrime, thanked Bengaluru Police for helping him get back his money. The man, Captain Rajendra Singh Waldia, wrote an appreciation letter to the Bengaluru Police and said, "Your efforts and direction will always remain in my memory." Sharing his letter on Twitter, Bengaluru Police said, "Appreciation is our biggest motivation."

267.title: Capable of handling any situation: Mumbai Police on Raj Thackeray’s May 3rd ultimatum
267.article_body: Ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray's May 3rd ultimatum on loudspeakers removal in mosques, the Mumbai Police said that it is capable of handling every situation and within five minutes the police will reach the location of any incident. Sensitive and vulnerable areas of Mumbai city have been identified and 24 hours patrolling is being done, the police said.

268.title: Samantha reunites with Vijay Deverakonda for Shiva Nirvana's film
268.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Vijay Deverakonda are teaming up again for a Telugu film which will be directed by Shiva Nirvana. The actors had previously worked together in 2018 film 'Mahanati' which was helmed by Nag Ashwin. "A special day for me...Can't wait to start shoot...a lovely family entertainer on the way," Shiva wrote while announcing the film on Twitter.

269.title: Canada very supportive of Sweden, Finland joining NATO: Trudeau
269.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has said that Canada would be "very supportive" of including Sweden and Finland in the NATO military alliance. Finland, which shares a 1,300-km border with Russia, and Sweden are considering joining NATO following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Russia has warned that it would deploy nuclear weapons in the region if both the countries join NATO.

270.title: Sheryl Sandberg pressurised news site to drop stories about ex-boyfriend: Report
270.article_body: Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg twice pressurised the Daily Mail to abandon reporting damaging stories about her then-boyfriend, Activision CEO Bobby Kotick, as per a report. Sandberg reportedly contacted the Daily Mail in 2016 and 2019 as it worked on stories that revealed that one of Kotick’s former girlfriends had obtained a temporary restraining order against him in 2014.

271.title: 24-year-old woman stabbed to death in front of her kids in Delhi
271.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death in front of her two minor sons in Southwest Delhi on Thursday, police said. The woman was stabbed, allegedly by a man she used to know, while heading home from a market, police added. The accused and the woman used to live nearby before she moved to another place, police stated.

272.title: B'luru police arrest 3 accused in 5 theft cases, seize 9.9 kg items
272.article_body: Bengaluru's Rajarajeshwari Nagar police have conducted an operation and arrested three people accused in five theft cases, the city's Deputy Commissioner of Police (West Division) Sanjeev M Patil tweeted on Thursday. He added that the police also seized 375 gm of jewellery and 9.573 kg of silverware along with two vehicles. Furthermore, he also shared a picture of the seizure.

273.title: NIIT’s online program offers 100% placements in digital marketing
273.article_body: NIIT's full-stack digital marketing program aims to transform first-time job seekers into job-ready professionals by equipping them with 360⁰ industry-ready competencies and soft skills. NIIT revealed the online program is developed to enable learners with skills like website development, e-commerce optimization, social media management, SEO and SEM, ROI optimization and more.

274.title: Virender Sehwag shares Ajay Devgn meme after MS Dhoni finishes run chase for CSK
274.article_body: After CSK wicketkeeper-batter MS Dhoni scored 16 runs off the last four deliveries to help CSK defeat MI on the last ball, Virender Sehwag shared a meme of Ajay Devgn's dialogue from 'Golmaal Again'. The meme read, "Kuchh nahi badla yaar. Aaj bhi sab kuchh waisa ka waisa hi hai (Nothing has changed. Everything is how it was even today)."

275.title: Why is Sachin's 143-run Sharjah knock called Desert Storm?
275.article_body: On April 22, 1998, Sachin Tendulkar scored 143 runs off 131 balls against Australia in Sharjah to ensure India's spot in the tri-series final. The match was interrupted by a sandstorm and the knock came to be popularly known as the 'Desert Storm'. Tendulkar went on to score another hundred two days later to help India win the tri-series.

276.title: Musk's Starlink signs 1st deal to provide in-flight WiFi
276.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX has signed its first deal with an air carrier to provide in-flight WiFi using the Starlink satellite network. As part of the deal, signed with semi-private jet service JSX, 100 aeroplanes will be equipped with Starlink terminals. The first flight having the terminal is expected to fly by the end of this year.

277.title: Betting addict commits theft at brother-in-law's house in Hyderabad, held
277.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested for committing theft at his brother-in-law's house in Hyderabad. Police also seized ₹85 lakh cash from the accused. According to police, the accused, identified as Mahander Kumar, was allegedly addicted to cricket betting. On April 15, he broke into his brother-in-law Bhomaram's house using a duplicate key and stole the money, police said.

278.title: If Twitter bid succeeds, will defeat spam bots or die trying: Musk
278.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in a tweet said that if their Twitter acquisition offer succeeds, they will "defeat all spambots or die trying!" In another tweet posted on Friday he said, "And authenticate all real humans." Musk also said that he has lined up $46.5 billion in financing to acquire Twitter and is considering taking his offer directly to shareholders.

279.title: Delhi Election Commission suspends preparations for civic body polls
279.article_body: State Election Commissioner of Delhi SK Srivastava, before his retirement on Wednesday, put on hold the preparations for the municipal corporation polls. The civic body elections were scheduled to be held in April. This comes after the Central government notified the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2022, merging Delhi's East, South and North Delhi Municipal Corporations into one.

280.title: Terrorists attack bus carrying CISF personnel in J&K; terrorists forced to run away
280.article_body: A bus carrying 15 Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel was attacked by terrorists in Jammu on Friday. "CISF averted the terrorist attack, retaliated effectively, and forced the terrorists to run away," CISF officials said. "In the line of action one ASI lost his life and two others were injured," said a senior officer of the CISF.

281.title: Legends use same game plan for 10+ years: Jaffer on Dhoni setting field for Pollard
281.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a picture of CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni setting the field for Kieron Pollard a ball before his dismissal. Referring to Pollard getting out in similar fashion earlier as well, Jaffer wrote, "Kids use same barber for 10+ years...Adults use same dp for 10+ years...Legends use same gameplan for 10+ years."

282.title: Mumbai Indians record worst-ever start to an IPL season by any team
282.article_body: With their last-ball defeat against CSK, MI have now recorded the worst-ever start to an IPL season by any team. MI have lost each of their first seven matches in IPL 2022, becoming the first team to lose their first seven matches of an IPL season. DC and RCB had lost their first six matches in 2013 and 2019, respectively.

283.title: Amit Mishra trolls Shahid Afridi after Jadeja drops catch, Dhoni misses stumping
283.article_body: Leg-spinner Amit Mishra trolled former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi after CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja dropped a catch and CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni missed a stumping against MI. He wrote, "Jadeja dropping a catch and MSD missing a stumping is like Shahid Afridi batting sensibly with eyes open. No one can believe it happened."

284.title: Ravindra Jadeja bows down to MS Dhoni after win vs MI, pic goes viral
284.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja bowed down to MS Dhoni after CSK defeated MI on the last ball in their IPL 2022 encounter on Thursday. Jadeja removed his cap and bowed down to Dhoni when both the teams were greeting each other after the match. Dhoni scored 16 runs off the last four deliveries to help CSK win.

285.title: Mike Tyson repeatedly punches man on flight, leaves him bloodied
285.article_body: A video obtained by TMZ shows Mike Tyson repeatedly punching a fellow passenger on a flight to Florida. Tyson's punches left the man with a bloodied forehead. A statement from Tyson's representatives says the incident involved an "aggressive passenger" who harassed Tyson and "threw a water bottle at him while he was in his seat".

286.title: Thunderstorm hits Hyderabad; flights from Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru diverted
286.article_body: Flights coming to Hyderabad from Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru and Visakhapatnam were diverted to other cities as the city and suburbs witnessed a thunderstorm on Thursday evening. Parts of Hyderabad and surrounding districts experienced light to moderate rainfall, along with hailstorm and lightning. Strong winds also uprooted trees and disrupted traffic movement at a few areas.

287.title: Man kills elderly man with mirror glass at Pune de-addiction centre
287.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly killed a 65-year-old man by hitting the latter's neck with a broken mirror glass at a de-addiction centre in Pune on Thursday. The accused also purportedly put his fingers in the wound to widen it, as per the FIR. A police statement said that the deceased had been reportedly abusing the accused.

288.title: 13-yr-old Mumbai boy choked to death by neighbour for spitting near their house
288.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was allegedly choked to death by his neighbour for spitting near their residence in Mumbai's Nagwadi. The accused, who was later arrested, had allegedly lied to the victim's mother and took him to a secluded place on the pretext of visiting a fair. The minor's body was found at an abandoned toilet.

289.title: 80-yr-old man dies after EV battery being charged in living room explodes in T'gana
289.article_body: An 80-year-old man died and four others in his family sustained burn injuries when the detachable battery of an electric scooter, kept on charge inside their living room in Telangana, exploded. While the police registered a case against the manufacturer Pure EV, the company said it had no record of the sale of this vehicle to the user.

290.title: MS Dhoni smashes 16 runs off last 4 balls as CSK defeat MI on last ball
290.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) defeated Mumbai Indians (MI) by three wickets to register their second victory in IPL 2022. MS Dhoni slammed 16 runs off the last four deliveries to help CSK chase down the 156-run target on the last ball of the match. MI have now lost their first seven matches in IPL 2022.

291.title: We have reserve stock of 2.23 cr tonnes of coal: Minister to Rahul
291.article_body: Union Power Minister RK Singh hit out at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, saying India has a reserve stock of 2.23 crore tonnes of coal. "Rahul Gandhi has tweeted that there is a coal crisis. He doesn't have any information," he said. This comes after Rahul Gandhi said that only eight days of coal was left in stock.

292.title: IMF, World Bank not designed to handle global crises: Yellen
292.article_body: The International Monetary Fund and World Bank were not designed to handle multiple crises they're currently dealing with, including Russia's war in Ukraine and the COVID-19 pandemic, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Thursday. She added, "We face challenges that will now require investment on a scale that an international institution can't manage on its own, like climate change."

293.title: MS Dhoni successfully plots Kieron Pollard's dismissal, video goes viral
293.article_body: A video of MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard's dismissal against CSK in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday has gone viral on social media. CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni placed Shivam Dube at the straightish long-on position. Pollard was caught by Dube after he smashed a Maheesh Theekshana delivery straight to him. "This is Dhoni's wicket," a fan tweeted.

294.title: I bow at feet of all 10 gurus: PM on Guru Tegh Bahadur's 400th Parkash Purab
294.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while taking part at the 400th Parkash Purab celebrations of Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur at Red Fort in Delhi, said "I bow at the feet of all 10 gurus." He congratulated people on the occasion. "I am happy that today our country is moving forward with full devotion on the ideals of our gurus," he added.

295.title: Mauritius PM visits Varanasi, offers prayers at Vishwanath Temple
295.article_body: Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth, who is on an eight-day visit to India, offered prayers at Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi. On Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a bilateral meeting with Mauritius PM after the inauguration of the Global Ayush Summit. PM Modi and his Mauritius counterpart took part in a roadshow in Ahmedabad on Tuesday.

296.title: Guru Tegh Bahadur became 'Hind di Chadar' in front of Aurangzeb: PM
296.article_body: Addressing the nation from Red Fort on the occasion of the 400th birth anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur, PM Narendra Modi said, "In front of Aurangzeb's tyrannical thinking, Guru Tegh Bahadur became 'Hind di Chadar' and stood like a rock." "This Red Fort is a witness that even though Aurangzeb severed many heads, but couldn't shake our faith," he added.

297.title: Russia bans entry of 29 Americans including Zuckerberg, US VP Kamala
297.article_body: Russia on Thursday banned 29 Americans from entering the Russian Federation "indefinitely". The Americans who were banned from entering Russia include Facebook Co-founder Mark Zuckerberg, US Vice President Kamala Harris, Deputy Defence Secretary Kathleen Hicks and Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby and other business leaders, officials and journalists. Russia also barred the entry of 61 Canadians.

298.title: SBI issues warning as customers get calls from 2 numbers, says 'Do not engage with them'
298.article_body: State Bank of India issued warning to its customers about frauds. Noting that customers are getting calls from two numbers, +91-8294710946 and +91-7362951973, SBI tweeted, "Do not engage with these numbers, & don't click on #phishing links...as they aren't associated with SBI." Customers getting calls from the numbers are being asked to click on a phishing link for KYC update.

299.title: India never posed a threat to any country, society: PM Modi at Red Fort
299.article_body: While addressing a gathering to mark the 400th birth anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur at Red Fort, PM Narendra Modi said that India has never posed a threat to any country or society. "When we talk about self-reliant India, we keep the progress of the whole world in front of the goal," PM Modi further said.

300.title: PM releases commemorative coin, postage stamp on 400th Parkash Purab
300.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday released a commemorative coin and a postage stamp at Red Fort in Delhi to mark the 400th birth anniversary of Sikh guru Tegh Bahadur. PM Modi also addressed the people from the Red Fort on the occasion. He also took part in 'Shabad Kirtan' held at the Red Fort.

301.title: UP CM orders construction of more jails to resolve overcrowding
301.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered the construction of new jails and more barracks in old jails to solve the issue of overcrowding. He said that sanitary napkins, dispensers and incinerator facility should be available at women's help desk in prisons. "Land should be purchased for the construction of district jails in Amroha, Sambhal, Shamli, and Muzaffarnagar," he added.

302.title: 7-yr-old MP boy with down syndrome hoists tricolour at Everest base camp
302.article_body: A seven-year-old boy, Avneesh, with down syndrome hoisted the tricolour at the Mount Everest base camp with his father. The duo from Madhya Pradesh's Indore trekked with a weight of 70 kg in which 10 kg was only medicines for Avneesh. His father also changed his diet plan while preparing to climb the Mount Everest.

303.title: Pics of Ranveer, Alia from sets of 'Rocky Aur Rani...' surface online
303.article_body: Pictures of Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt from the sets of 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' have been shared by Churni Ganguly. "Elated to share the floor with legends like Dharmendra ji, Jaya Bachchan and Shabana Azmi, and of course, Alia Bhatt and Ranveer Singh," Churni captioned the post. The film is directed by Karan Johar.

304.title: Ethiopians queue up outside Russian Embassy to fight in Ukraine
304.article_body: Hundreds of Ethiopians queued up outside the Russian Embassy in Addis Ababa over the last two weeks to volunteer to fight for Moscow in Ukraine, Reuters reported. The volunteers reportedly arrived at the embassy with their military records after rumours of recruitment for Russian troops surfaced on social media. Russia, however, has not confirmed deploying Ethiopian volunteers to Ukraine.

305.title: Do you need bulldozers to clear stalls, chairs, boxes: SC on Delhi demolition
305.article_body: During the hearing on the anti-encroachment drive in the violence-hit Jahangirpuri area of Delhi, the Supreme Court asked North Delhi Municipal Corporation, "Do you need bulldozers to clear stalls, chairs, tables, and boxes?" This was after Solicitor General Tushar Mehta submitted that there was no provision for notice to remove stalls, chairs and other things from footpaths and roads.

306.title: Tesla robot to be worth more than its self-driving business: Musk
306.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk, said the company's robot Optimus would eventually be worth more than its full self-driving (FSD) business. "I was surprised that people didn't realise the magnitude of the Optimus robot program," Musk stated during Wednesday's earnings call. Optimus, a 5'8" humanoid robot, was first introduced in August 2021 during Tesla's inaugural AI Day.

307.title: US Prez announces additional $800 million military aide for Ukraine
307.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday announced an additional $800 million in military aid for Ukraine. According to the US President, the new package will include heavy artillery, howitzers, 1,44,000 rounds of ammunition and tactical drones. "We're in a critical window now of time where they're going to set the stage for the next phase of this war," Biden said.

308.title: HD Kumaraswamy asks K'taka CM to call meeting of religious leaders
308.article_body: JD(S) leader and former CM HD Kumaraswamy asked Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to call a meeting of religious leaders of all communities of the state amid recent communal tensions. Hitting out at BJP and Congress for disturbing peace, he said, "The issue of use of loudspeakers and sound pollution has started now, there was no such issue till now."

309.title: Chhattisgarh roads will be like American roads in 5 years: Gadkari
309.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari has assured to build roads in Chhattisgarh that will be like the roads in the US over the next five years. "For the growth of any state, strengthening water, transport, power and communication sectors are very important. The balanced development of these four sectors accelerates the agriculture and industry growth," he said.

310.title: HCL Technologies' profit rises 23.9% to ₹3,593 crore in Q4
310.article_body: HCL Technologies on Thursday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,593 crore for the quarter ended March 2022, up 23.9% from ₹2,899 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company said its revenue from operations increased 15.1% year-on-year to ₹22,597 crore. Further, the board of HCL Technologies has declared an interim dividend of ₹18 per share for the FY2022-23.

311.title: Old pic of Akshay Kumar's cigarette ad surfaces after he says he has not endorsed tobacco
311.article_body: An old cigarette ad featuring Akshay Kumar has resurfaced after the actor stepped back from a pan masala brand's ad following criticism. In a statement posted on social media, Akshay said that he "has not and will not" endorse tobacco. "'While I have not endorsed tobacco'!! Cigarettes are made of gulkand kya?" a Twitter user wrote.

312.title: Cong leader writes to CM Mamata on 'miserable' condition of Muslims in WB
312.article_body: West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee seeking her attention to the "pathetic and miserable condition of the Muslim minority" in the state. "Despite your government being in power in West Bengal for more than a decade, the minorities are still marginalised, backward and neglected sections of the society," he wrote.

313.title: 2 women labourers among 4 die in lightning strike in Andhra Pradesh
313.article_body: At least four persons, including two women farm labourers, died after they were struck by lightning in Adoni in the Kurnool district of Andhra Pradesh during a spell of rain on Thursday evening. Officials said the two women workers were returning from the fields when they were struck by lightning and died on the spot.

314.title: World no. 11 Alcaraz beats Kwon in opening match at Barcelona Open
314.article_body: World number 11 Carlos Alcaraz on Wednesday beat Soonwoo Kwon 6-1, 2-6, 6-2 in his opening match at the Barcelona Open. The match was Alcaraz's first on home soil since losing to fellow Spaniard Rafael Nadal at the Madrid Open last May. The 18-year-old improved to 19-3 this season as he seeks his third ATP tour title of 2022.

315.title: BMW unveils new all-electric i7 with 'private cinema screen' in the back seat
315.article_body: German carmaker BMW has unveiled its all-electric 2023 BMW i7 sedan. It features what BMW is calling a 'Theatre Screen', a 31.3-inch panoramic display in 32:9 format with 8K resolution which extends downwards from the roof. "The screen transforms the second row of seats into an exclusive private cinema on wheels," BMW said.

316.title: Instagram to downrank TikTok reposts, promote native content
316.article_body: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri has announced the company's plan to downrank Reels videos that are not original to the platform. This means all the reshared content from apps like TikTok will soon be shown less to promote original content. "If you create something from scratch, you should get more credit than if you're resharing something," Mosseri stated.

317.title: Building owned by ex-BJP MLA, who switched to SP, bulldozed in UP
317.article_body: An "illegal" building owned by SP leader Roshan Lal Verma was demolished by the authorities in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur. The former MLA had switched to the SP from BJP ahead of recently-held state Assembly election. The structure was constructed on a government land, District Magistrate Umesh Pratap Singh said.

318.title: CBI files chargesheet against ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna, Subramanian
318.article_body: CBI has filed its chargesheet against National Stock Exchange's (NSE) ex-MD and CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian in connection with the co-location scam case. In the chargesheet, CBI has accused Ramkrishna of allegedly abusing her official position in key decisions. SEBI had earlier charged her with alleged governance lapses in Subramanian's appointment.

319.title: 'You told me you'll bat', Rohit tells Jadeja after he opts to bowl first; video goes viral
319.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma's banter with Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja after CSK won the toss and elected to bowl first in their IPL 2022 match has gone viral. When Jadeja was making his way back after completing the interview following the toss, Rohit stopped him and said, "Bowling? You told me you will bat."

320.title: PURE EV recalls 2,000 e-scooters after multiple fire incidents
320.article_body: PURE EV has issued a recall of 2,000 of its ETrance Plus and EPluto 7G models in view of fire incidents involving its vehicles in Chennai and Nizamabad. The vehicles and batteries will be thoroughly checked for any imbalance issues, the company said. The dealership network will contact concerned customers while an expeditious campaign will be ensured, PURE EV added.

321.title: Marvel keeps updating storyline of 'Doctor Strange 2': Bruce Campbell
321.article_body: Actor Bruce Campbell said Marvel keeps updating the storyline of 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "Sam [Raimi, director]...had to add scenes that [Marvel] told him he had to shoot...he's removed scenes that no longer apply," Bruce said. "Until May rolls around I don't think Benedict Cumberbatch even knows if he's in this movie or not," he added.

322.title: No cap on Ukrainian refugees despite accomodation problems: Ireland
322.article_body: Ireland won't cap the number of Ukrainian refugees it accepts despite the government's current challenges in housing them, Irish Justice Minister Helen McEntee said on Thursday. McEntee stated that she'd support plans to financially help households that take in Ukrainian refugees. An estimated 25,000 Ukrainians have arrived in Ireland since the Russian invasion of Ukraine began on February 24.

323.title: Free COVID vaccine precaution dose for all above 18 years at govt centres in Delhi
323.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday announced that the precaution dose of COVID-19 vaccine will be free for all eligible beneficiaries aged above 18 in government vaccination centres with immediate effect. The precaution dose was already free for healthcare workers and those aged above 60. The provision of paid booster dose in private vaccination centres will also continue, an official order said.

324.title: 10 people killed in mosque blast in Afghanistan; ISIS claims responsibility
324.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and over 50 people were injured in a blast at a Shiite mosque in the northern Afghanistan city of Mazar-e-Sharif on Thursday, according to reports. The Islamic State (ISIS) has reportedly claimed responsibility for the mosque blast. Separately, at least four people were killed in another blast that hit Afghanistan's Kunduz city on Thursday.

325.title: I had faith I'd witness this day: Yash on 'KGF 2' success
325.article_body: Yash, taking to Instagram, thanked his fans for showing love towards 'KGF: Chapter 2'. He shared a story on faith and said, "There was a small village...facing a situation of drought...villagers decided to have a prayer meet." "There was one boy...turned up with an umbrella...that was faith. I'm like that...boy who had the faith of witnessing this day," he added.

326.title: Man City beat Brighton 3-0 to regain 1 point lead over Liverpool in PL
326.article_body: Manchester City on Wednesday beat Brighton 3-0 to regain top spot on the Premier League table and a one point lead over rivals Liverpool. Riyad Mahrez, Phil Foden and Bernardo Silva scored for City. Liverpool had taken a two-point lead over Manchester City on Tuesday after beating Manchester United 4-0. City now have 77 points from 32 games this season.

327.title: Sonia Gandhi keen on a united Congress in Rajasthan: Sachin Pilot
327.article_body: Ex-Rajasthan Deputy CM and Congress leader Sachin Pilot, who met party chief Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday, said that Gandhi is "very keen" on a united performance by the party for upcoming state Assembly elections. Pilot added that they also discussed organisational polls and party strengthening strategies. Rajasthan is set to go to the polls in 2023.

328.title: Dwayne Bravo touches Kieron Pollard's feet ahead of CSK-MI match, video viral
328.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo touching his compatriot and MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard's feet ahead of their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. Pollard on Wednesday announced his retirement from international cricket. MI are currently last on the IPL 2022 points table, while CSK are ninth.

329.title: Elon Musk secures $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter
329.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has said a $46.5 billion financing is lined up to acquire Twitter and he is considering starting a tender offer for its outstanding shares. Musk said Morgan Stanley and other financial institutions have committed around $25.5 billion in debt financing. "Almost $21 billion comes from Musk's own pocket through equity financing," Bloomberg reported.

330.title: Hunters pose with 8-ft tusks after killing one of the biggest elephants in Botswana
330.article_body: Pictures showing trophy hunters posing with one of the biggest elephants in Botswana after killing it have surfaced. A photo showed a hunter holding its nearly eight-foot tusks. Criticising the country's move of reversing its decision to ban hunting, Botswana's former President Ian Khama said, "An elephant that tour operators constantly tried to show tourists as an iconic attraction...is dead."

331.title: Bukayo Saka's penalty strike helps Arsenal beat Chelsea 4-2 in PL
331.article_body: Bukayo Saka on Wednesday scored from the penalty spot in the 92nd minute to help Arsenal beat Chelsea 4-2 in the Premier League. With six games left to play this season, Arsenal are currently fifth on the table and level on points with Tottenham Hotspur in fourth place with 57 points. Arsenal's Eddie Nketiah scored twice in the game.

332.title: 'Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse' release postponed to June 2, 2023
332.article_body: 'Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse', which was initially slated to release on October 7 this year, has been postponed to June 2, 2023. The film is a sequel to the 2018 film 'Spider-Man: Into the Spider-verse'. Dakota Johnson and Sydney Sweeney-starrer 'Madame Web', a spin-off of 'Spider-Man', will release on July 7, 2023.

333.title: If we win all our games we will be champions: Man City's Pep Guardiola
333.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said his side is "not stupid" and know they must win all their remaining matches to win the Premier League title this season. City are currently one point ahead of Liverpool with six games left to play. "If we draw, drop just two points, Liverpool will be champions," Guardiola said.

334.title: 'Appeasement politics' in J'khand to blame for pro-Pak slogans: BJP leader
334.article_body: BJP leader Deepak Prakash alleged that "politics of appeasement" in Jharkhand is responsible for alleged pro-Pakistan slogans that were raised in Giridih on Thursday. "Since Hemant Soren’s government...[came] to power, there's been a continuous gathering of anti-national forces," he said. At least 10 persons were booked for shouting the slogans during nomination filing process for Panchayat polls.

335.title: New Pak govt to place members of Imran Khan cabinet on no-fly list
335.article_body: PM Shehbaz Sharif-led newly-elected Pakistan government has decided to place members of former PM Imran Khan's cabinet on the no-fly list, ANI reported. They reportedly believe the ministers of the former government would possibly flee with "corruption money" which they had collected during their regime. Notably, Khan was removed as Pakistan PM after he lost the no-trust vote against him.

336.title: Vote for BJP if you want criminals to come to power: Delhi CM Kejriwal
336.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday told the people of Karnataka to vote for BJP if they wanted criminals to come to power in the state. "But if you want better schools, vote for the AAP. If you want hooligans, vote for them, but if you want hospitals, vote for Kejriwal," he further said.

337.title: Pic shows mysterious woman with Kim Jong-un, speculated to be his half sister
337.article_body: A mysterious woman has been spotted with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un at several events recently amid speculations that she's his half sister Kim Sol-song. The woman has also been seen handing him his speech at a large political rally in February. "This woman might be his private secretary," expert on North Korea's elite Michael Madden suggested.

338.title: Considered sacrilege for woman to date younger man: Malaika on dating Arjun
338.article_body: Malaika Arora, speaking about the 12-year gap between her and her boyfriend Arjun Kapoor, has said, "It's often considered a sacrilege for a woman to date a younger man." She called it a "misogynist" approach to female relationships. Malaika shared her mother's teaching and said, "She always told me to live life on my terms and be independent."

339.title: Vidyut Jammwal-starrer 'Khuda Haafiz 2' to release on June 17
339.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal's upcoming film 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter 2 Agni Pariksha' will receive a theatrical release on June 17. "Witness the #AgniPariksha of Sameer & Nargis in #KhudaHaafizChapterllAgniPariksha. Releasing in theatres on June 17, 2022," Vidyut wrote on Instagram. The film will also feature Shivaleeka Oberoi. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film 'Khuda Haafiz'.

340.title: Aus Oppn leader tests COVID-19 positive while campaigning for polls
340.article_body: Australian Opposition leader Anthony Albanese said on Thursday that he has tested positive for COVID-19 ahead of the May 21 federal elections. The 59-year-old politician from the Labor Party said that he will quarantine for a week at his residence in Sydney. Notably, his political opponent and Australian PM Scott Morrison had also tested positive for the virus last month.

341.title: Pic of Hardik Pandya's lookalike dancing at Coachella goes viral, Twitter users react
341.article_body: A tweet has recently gone viral where a Twitter user has compared a background dancer, who was performing with rapper Doja Cat at the Coachella Music Festival, with cricketer Hardik Pandya. "Now we know why he missed GT's previous match," a Twitter user jokingly commented. "Hardik Pandya rehearsing for IPL closing ceremony," another comment read.

342.title: Rohit Sharma records most ducks in IPL history
342.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma got out for a two-ball duck against CSK on Thursday. Rohit has now been dismissed for a duck in IPL 14 times, which is the most number of ducks for any batter. He overtook Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla, Mandeep Singh, Parthiv Patel, Ajinkya Rahane and Ambati Rayudu, who have recorded 13 ducks each.

343.title: Goenka lists 5 reasons for low IPL TV ratings, says 'Virat, Dhoni haven't fired yet'
343.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to list five reasons why "IPL TV ratings are down". "The crowd favourites MI and CSK playing poor and heroes like Virat, Dhoni, Rohit haven't fired yet," were among the reasons he listed. When filmmaker Pritish Nandy tweeted, "The product is slowly tiring," Goenka responded, "I think that's the real answer."

344.title: Navya edits her Instagram post after it sparks dating rumours with Siddhant
344.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda has made changes to her recent Instagram post's caption after it sparked rumours that she is dating actor Siddhant Chaturvedi. She reportedly also deleted a comment that she had made on one of Siddhant's pictures. Siddhant had posted a picture from the hilltop, on which Navya had commented a smiling sun emoji.

345.title: AAP will form govt in K'taka like it did in Delhi, Punjab: Kejriwal
345.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said his party will form the government in Karnataka just like it did in Delhi and Punjab. The previous Congress government in Karnataka was called "20% commission government" and the current BJP government is called "40% commission government", Kejriwal said. "Delhi has 0% commission government because there's a hardcore honest government," he added.

346.title: Negligent firms will be penalised: Gadkari on EV fire incidents
346.article_body: Electric vehicle (EV) firms found to be negligent in their processes will be heavily penalised, Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said while referring to incidents of EVs catching fire. He added that the Centre has constituted a committee to enquire into these incidents. Based on the committee's findings, the government will issue necessary orders on defaulting companies, Gadkari added.

347.title: CSK to bowl first against MI, 2 players making their debut for MI
347.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja won the toss and elected to bowl first against MI in their IPL 2022 clash at DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai. Pacer Riley Meredith and off-spinner Hrithik Shokeen are making their debut for MI. CSK have made two changes to their playing XI, with Dwaine Pretorius and Mitchell Santner replacing Chris Jordan and Moeen Ali, respectively.

348.title: Maternal deaths have tripled in Lebanon amid economic crisis: UNICEF
348.article_body: Number of women dying due to pregnancy-related complications has nearly tripled in Lebanon amid its economic turmoil, UNICEF said on Wednesday. UNICEF stated that one-third of children couldn't access healthcare in the country until October last year, adding that neonatal fatalities there have also increased. Roughly 40% of doctors have left Lebanon after it plunged into economic crisis in 2019.

349.title: BMC increases efforts as Mumbai accounts for half of Maha Covid cases
349.article_body: With over half of Maharashtra's Covid-19 cases being reported from maximum city Mumbai, the city's civic body BMC has asked civic officials to increase daily testing and ensure strict contact-tracing.
