"We have directed officials to increase testing, surveillance, contact tracing, strict implementation of home isolation protocol and booster dose to the eligible population," a BMC official said.

350.title: 'I don't know, who is he?': Assam CM on Jignesh Mevani's arrest
350.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma claimed ignorance on Thursday when asked about Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani, who was arrested on Wednesday night in connection with allegedly offensive tweets about PM Narendra Modi. "I don't know. Who is he? I'm not aware of the specifics. Who will do vendetta politics when I don't know him?" he said.

351.title: ITC to acquire 10% stake in Blupin Technologies for ₹39 cr
351.article_body: ITC on Thursday announced that it will acquire 10.7% stake in Blupin Technologies for up to ₹39.34 crore. Blupin Technologies is a web and app-based content-to-community-to-commerce platform that offers mother and baby care products and services under the brand 'Mylo'. The investment will provide the company an early mover advantage and an expanded presence in the D2C space, ITC said.

352.title: UK PM Boris Johnson visits Akshardham Temple in Gujarat
352.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson visited the Akshardham Temple in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Thursday. He arrived in Ahmedabad on Thursday morning on a two-day visit to India. Earlier in the day, he visited the Sabarmati Ashram in Ahmedabad and tried his hands on a charkha. He is the first UK PM to visit Gujarat.

353.title: Don't lecture the judiciary: SC to Home Ministry on Abu Salem case
353.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday rejected the Centre's stand that gangster Abu Salem's petition against his jail sentence exceeding 25 years is premature. It told the Home Ministry, "Don't lecture...judiciary. We don't take it kindly when you tell us to decide something which you have to decide." It added, "The Home Secretary is nobody to tell us to decide the issue."

354.title: Shooting of 'Fast & Furious 10' begins, Vin Diesel shares film's logo
354.article_body: The shooting of Vin Diesel-starrer 'Fast and Furious 10' has started. Vin took to Instagram on Wednesday to share the logo of the film that read, "Fast X". The actor captioned the post, "Day one." The film will also feature Charlize Theron, Tyrese Gibson, Ludacris, Michelle Rodriguez, Sung Kang, Jason Momoa, Daniela Melchior and Brie Larson.

355.title: PM gave me certificate of 'imandaar' CM: Arvind Kejriwal
355.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday claimed that PM Narendra Modi had given him the "certificate of imandaar (honest) CM". "PM made the CBI raid my residence. Officials entered my bedroom but they couldn't find anything. Eventually, PM gave me the certificate of 'imandaar' CM. Ours is an honest government," Kejriwal added.

356.title: Man accused of rape injured in police firing while trying to escape
356.article_body: A rape accused was injured in firing when he allegedly tried to escape from custody in Assam's Nagaon. Police said that he tried to escape when he was taken to the hospital after he complained of chest pain. When he refused to stop even after repeated warnings, police had to fire and he was hit on the leg, police added.

357.title: 10 persons booked for shouting Pro-Pakistan slogans in Jharkhand
357.article_body: At least ten persons were booked in connection with a video that showed pro-Pakistan slogans being raised in Giridih, Jharkhand. The incident reportedly took place during a nomination filing procession for the Panchayat elections. "Mukhiya candidate Mohammad Shakir's supporters were sloganeering near block office gate... pro-Pakistan slogans were raised," sub-divisional police officer said.

358.title: UK announces new sanctions against Russia over its Ukraine invasion
358.article_body: UK on Thursday announced new sanctions against Russia in response to its Ukraine's invasion. The country added 26 new designations to its list of sanctions against Russia, which include the Russian army's Colonel General Nikolay Bogdanovsky, who holds the position of First Deputy Chief of the General Staff, and defence companies. Earlier, UK imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin.

359.title: Peter Schmeichel, Ian Wright among 6 new inductees into PL Hall of Fame
359.article_body: The Premier League on Thursday said Manchester United's former goalkeeper Peter Schmeichel and former Arsenal striker Ian Wright are among six new inductees into its Hall of Fame. Manchester City's Sergio Aguero and Vincent Kompany along with Chelsea's Didier Drogba and Manchester United's Paul Scholes are the other four inductees. Schmeichel won five Premier League titles with Manchester United.

360.title: YouTuber purposely crashed his plane so he could record a video, says US govt body
360.article_body: Federal Aviation Administration has found that Trevor Jacob, a YouTuber who posted a video of himself parachuting out of a plane that he claimed had malfunctioned, purposely abandoned it and allowed it to crash in Southern California. FAA will immediately revoke Jacob's private pilot certificate. Experts had earlier expressed doubts, claiming the video was orchestrated for views and likes.

361.title: BSF officer shoots himself in Tripura's Dhalai
361.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) officer allegedly died by suicide after shooting himself outside his battalion headquarters in Dhalai, Tripura. "Prima facie it appeared that the officer shot himself with his service revolver. We have registered a case of unnatural death to find out what had led to the fatal incident," Dhalai SP Ramesh Yadav said.

362.title: 'My son had fractures, 16 stitches due to fault in Ola scooter', says father; firm denies
362.article_body: A father claimed that his son had an accident after Ola Electric's Ola S1 Pro scooter accelerated on a speed breaker instead of slowing. "The scooter went airborne...crashing and skidding...He had fractures in left hand and 16 stitches in right hand," Twitter user Balwant Singh tweeted. Ola Electric responded, "There's no issue with the scooter...we advise you to...please ride safely."

363.title: If I had got injured, I would have been angry: Curran on missing IPL 2022
363.article_body: Talking about missing IPL 2022 due to a lower back injury, ex-CSK all-rounder Sam Curran said, "The advice was for my back to heal properly. If I had gone and got injured, I would have been angry at myself." "I was gutted not to [play in]...IPL 2022. It was hard to take but...the sensible thing to do," added Curran.

364.title: Delhi Police arrests 104, recover 69kg of drugs in last 24 hrs
364.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 104 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 69 kilograms of narcotics substances in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 15 proclaimed offenders, seized 815 litres of illicit liquor and recovered 20 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 5,607 calls, the post added.

365.title: India willing to increase Brazilian oil imports many times over: Puri
365.article_body: Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday said India is willing to increase crude oil imports from Brazil "many times over" under "long-term special contracts". After meeting with Brazilian Energy Minister Bento Albuquerque, Puri said that Indian companies will also be looking at boosting investment in Brazil. Albuquerque said Brazil is willing to meet India's increased demand for oil.

366.title: Will co-create defence, aerospace tech: Adani after meeting UK PM
366.article_body: India's richest person Gautam Adani on Thursday said the Adani Group will work with companies from the UK to "co-create defence and aerospace technologies" as part of the Indian government's Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative. This comes after Adani met with UK PM Boris Johnson in Gujarat. Johnson and Adani focused their discussions on key issues like energy transition and climate action.

367.title: Admissions to PG courses will soon be done through CUET: UGC Chairman
367.article_body: Admissions to postgraduate courses will soon be conducted through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET), M Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman of the University Grants Commission said on Thursday. "We are internally discussing conducting CUET twice a year so that the students who could not appear for it the first time can do so in the second chance," he said.

368.title: Woman booked for trying to extort ₹5 crore from Maha Minister
368.article_body: An FIR was registered against a woman who allegedly tried to extort ₹5 crore from Maharashtra Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde. Police officials said that the woman called him from international mobile numbers, demanding a shop and an expensive mobile phone. She threatened to defame him on social media if he did not accept her demands, the police added.

369.title: Over 20 cr unused COVID-19 vaccines available with States, UTs: Centre
369.article_body: Over 20.16 crore balance and unutilised COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with states and Union Territories (UTs) to be administered, informed the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare in its official statement on Thursday. The Union Government is committed to accelerating the pace and expanding the scope of COVID-19 vaccination throughout the country, said the Ministry.

370.title: Man Utd would be battling relegation without Ronaldo: Piers Morgan
370.article_body: Reacting to Manchester United's 0-4 loss against Liverpool, British broadcaster Piers Morgan tweeted, "United would be facing a relegation battle without Cristiano Ronaldo this season in the Premier League." "Abysmal performance," added Morgan in his tweet. Ronaldo has scored 15 goals in 26 Premier League games so far this season. Manchester United are currently sixth on the points table.

371.title: 2 sisters, tortured by dad, rescued from child marriage bid in Indore
371.article_body: Authorities in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district rescued two sisters, aged 15 and 17, who were allegedly being forced to get married, an official said on Thursday. The girls were being compelled to marry two youths from Dewas district, official added. The girls also alleged that their father often tortured them in an inebriated state and had tried to kill them.

372.title: Indians can now use BHIM UPI to make payments in UAE
372.article_body: BHIM UPI is now live at NeoPay terminals across the UAE and can be used by Indian tourists to pay for their purchases at shops and merchant stores, the international arm of NPCI announced. The partnership between NPCI International Payments Ltd and NeoPay was announced last year. Notably, Indians can already use UPI in countries like Bhutan and Singapore.

373.title: We will name Shivamogga airport after BS Yediyurappa: K'taka CM
373.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai announced that the under-construction airport in Shivamogga, Karnataka, will be named after former state CM BS Yediyurappa. He said that the state government has taken a decision in this regard and will send the proposal to civil aviation ministry. "It would give a big boost for education, health services and industrialisation of Shivamogga," Bommai added.

374.title: ₹500 fine for not wearing masks in Gurugram, 3 other Haryana districts: CM
374.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday said a fine of ₹500 will be imposed for not wearing face masks in Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat and Jhajjar districts of the state. He said authorities in these four districts have been directed to keep a vigil on COVID-19 situation. The state had earlier lifted the mandate of wearing masks on April 2.

375.title: We intend to deliver more weapons: Danish PM on visit to Kyiv
375.article_body: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen on Thursday pledged to deliver more weapons to Ukraine after visiting the capital Kyiv with Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez. Frederiksen and Sanchez are in Kyiv to meet with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a gesture of support. "We intend to deliver more weapons to Ukraine because that is what is most needed," Frederiksen said.

376.title: Sainz signs 2-year contract extension to remain at Ferrari until 2024
376.article_body: Carlos Sainz has signed a new two-year contract keeping him at Ferrari until the end of 2024. "I have always said that there is no better Formula One team to race for and after over a year with them, I can confirm that putting on this race suit and representing this team is unique and incomparable," Sainz said.

377.title: India criticises US politician, says 'She visited part of J&K illegally occupied by Pak'
377.article_body: India's External Affairs Ministry criticised US Congresswoman Ilhan Omar, who was on a visit to Pakistan, saying, "She has visited a part of...J&K that's currently illegally occupied by Pakistan." Calling it condemnable, MEA said, "If such a politician wishes to practise her narrow-minded politics at home that may be her business, but violating our territorial integrity...makes this ours."

378.title: Was in shock, there was too much blood: Malaika on her car accident
378.article_body: Malaika Arora, in a recent interview, opened up about her car accident that took place at the Mumbai-Pune expressway earlier this month. "Physically, I am recovering, but mentally, I feel that it doesn't go away completely," she stated. Describing her accident, Malaika said, "I was in shock...I wanted to know...whether I was alive or not. There was too much blood."

379.title: Mumbai man stopped from kissing woman, spits on policeman
379.article_body: A 27-year-old man from Mumbai was booked after he allegedly manhandled and spat on a police constable, who confronted him for kissing and hugging a woman at Vasai railway station. "He abused and threatened me and spat on my face twice and caught my collar," the constable said in his complaint. The accused is not arrested yet, the police added.

380.title: Hyd constable harasses, extorts ₹30,000 from 2 people, dismissed
380.article_body: A constable in Hyderabad, Akash Bhatt was dismissed from service for harassing and extorting ₹30,000 from two people. While patrolling on April 15, the constable spotted two people and demanded ₹15,000 and let them go after taking their phone numbers, reports said. Bhatt, however, continued to harass them over the phone and took another ₹15,000.

381.title: Sir David Attenborough named ‘Champion of the Earth’ by UN
381.article_body: The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) has presented Sir David Attenborough with the Champions of the Earth Lifetime Achievement Award.  The award recognizes Attenborough's "outsized impact on the global environmental movement". "We know what the problems are and we know how to solve them. What we lack is unified action," the 95-year-old naturalist said.

382.title: Govt to decide LIC IPO timing within this week: Official
382.article_body: The government would decide the timing of LIC IPO, initially planned for in March, within this week, a senior official told PTI. It'd be tough to decide whether to go ahead with the retail and domestic investor demand or wait for FIIs, the official added. Notably, if the IPO is not launched by May 12, it'd be deferred till August-September.

383.title: Wisden unveils its 10 best cricket images of 2021
383.article_body: Wisden has unveiled its 10 best cricket images of 2021. An image of England's Jos Buttler jumping over Australia's Steve Smith during England's win against eventual champions Australia at T20 World Cup 2021 has been named Wisden Photograph of 2021. The top 10 images include photographs of Jasprit Bumrah warming up and Joe Root expressing disappointment on dismissal, among others.

384.title: What are the features of the world's 'most powerful missile' tested by Russia?
384.article_body: Russia has successfully tested the Sarmat intercontinental ballistic missile, which Russia's Defence Ministry called the world's "most powerful missile". It weighs more than 200 tonnes and is able to transport multiple warheads. As per Russian media, Sarmat is a three-stage, liquid-fueled missile with a range of 18,000 km. It has been designed to elude anti-missile defence systems.

385.title: Reports of my husband being gay are so silly: Hugh Jackman's wife
385.article_body: Actor Hugh Jackman's wife Deborra-Lee Furness has denied the reports that Hugh is a gay man still in the closet. "It's so silly...It just amazes me that these magazines continue to get away with it," Furness added. "If he was gay, he could be gay. He didn't have to hide in the closet anymore," the Australian actress further said.

386.title: 9 bodies found outside Kyiv, some show signs of torture: Ukraine
386.article_body: Andriy Niebytov, the police chief in Ukraine's Kyiv region, has said the bodies of nine civilians have been found in the town of Borodyanka. He said, "These people were killed by the occupiers and some show signs of torture. The Russian military knowingly shot civilians who didn't put up any resistance." Niebytov added police had discovered two graves around Borodyanka.

387.title: No oil spills on Gultekdi flyover, beware of rumours: PMC to people
387.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has refuted claims of oil spills causing accidents on city's Gultekdi flyover, terming the reports as "fake". Taking to Twitter, PMC stated that a fire brigade vehicle had been sent to location, which found no oil spills in the area. "We request citizens to not believe in any rumours being spread on social media," PMC tweeted.

388.title: Abhishek Bachchan is very humble & supportive: 'Dasvi' co-star Arun
388.article_body: 'Dasvi' actor Arun Kushwah, speaking about his film's co-star Abhishek Bachchan, has said, "Abhishek sir is a great company, very humble and supportive." Arun further stated that he and Abhishek never had a boring moment together. "I also believe that you get to learn a lot when you work with experienced individuals," he added. The film also featured Yami Gautam.

389.title: UK PM climbs onto a bulldozer at JCB factory in Gujarat; video surfaces
389.article_body: A video showing UK PM Boris Johnson climbing onto a bulldozer at JCB's new factory and waving during his visit to Gujarat's Panchmahal has surfaced online. Johnson was visiting the factory with Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel on Thursday. He also met business tycoon Gautam Adani, who tweeted, "Honoured to host Boris Johnson, the first UK PM to visit Gujarat."

390.title: India's richest person Adani hosts UK PM Boris Johnson in Gujarat; shares pic
390.article_body: Gautam Adani, India's richest person and the world's sixth-richest person with $117 billion wealth, hosted UK's PM Boris Johnson on Thursday at the Adani Group headquarters in Gujarat. Johnson, who's on a two-day visit to India, is the first UK PM to visit Gujarat. Adani tweeted that he was "honoured" to host the UK PM.

391.title: No taboos for us: Germany's Baerbock on providing weapons to Ukraine
391.article_body: Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said there are "no taboos" in Germany supplying armoured vehicles and weapons to Ukraine as Russia's invasion of the country continues. She added that Germany's priority was to quickly provide Ukraine with Soviet-designed kit that its military could use without requiring any extra training. "We know that everyday counts," Baerbock said.

392.title: Adani JV among 14 firms chosen under ₹120 crore-drone PLI scheme
392.article_body: Fourteen drone companies, including Adani's joint venture company with Israel's Elbit, and ideaForge Technology, have been selected as beneficiaries of a production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme, the Aviation Ministry stated. The PLI, worth ₹120 crore, is aimed at boosting drone manufacturing in India. The firms will be given 20% of the "value addition" made by them in the next three years.

393.title: Odisha Dalit man forced to rub nose in spit for refusing ₹500 temple donation
393.article_body: A 32-year-old Dalit man was allegedly forced to rub his nose in his own spit for refusing to donate ₹500 for a temple renovation work in Odisha's Kendrapara, police said. His wife alleged that the village sarpanch abused the couple for refusing to give the donation. The sarpanch, who dismissed the allegations, has been booked along with three others.

394.title: NTPC to use Delhi's sludge to produce environment-friendly energy
394.article_body: National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) will use the sludge produced in Delhi Jal Board's sewage treatment plants (STPs) to produce energy in an environment-friendly manner, a statement said. Using sludge to produce energy will reduce net carbon dioxide emissions and control water and land pollution, the statement added. NTPC aims to produce 60GW of energy through renewable sources by 2032.

395.title: Chinese Defence Minister warns US, says 'don't underestimate China'
395.article_body: Chinese National Defence Minister Wei Fenghe held a telephonic conversation with US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin and exchanged views on issues like maritime and air security and the Ukraine situation. During the conversation, Wei reportedly warned the US "not to underestimate China's determination and capability". China hopes to establish stable major-country relations with the US, he added.

396.title: Russia has warned Mariupol residents to wear white ribbon or get shot: Ukraine
396.article_body: The Russian forces in the besieged city of Mariupol, Ukraine, have threatened to shoot civilians if they don't wear white ribbons, Petro Andriushchenko, advisor to the Mayor of Mariupol, said. The white ribbon is believed to be a symbol for Russian troops to identify Ukrainians who've accepted defeat. Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday claimed to have "successfully liberated" Mariupol.

397.title: WhatsApp planning paid multi-device support for businesses: Report
397.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a paid subscription plan for WhatsApp Business, which will allow users to connect up to 10 devices to a single WhatsApp account, WaBetaInfo reported. This will allow multiple employees to access the same account on their phones. Currently, users can connect four additional devices for free, both on WhatsApp and WhatsApp Business.

398.title: Man with degree to check specs number treats UP woman, she goes blind
398.article_body: A woman was rendered blind after a man, Kuldeep, who has degree only for checking number of glasses worn by people, treated her at a "fake eye clinic". The victim, Prema Devi, had visited Kuldeep's clinic on April 5. Kuldeep had given her some eye-drops. Her son said that his mother lost her eyesight three days after receiving the medicine.

399.title: Pay ₹2,000 fine for taking selfies on railway tracks: Southern Railway
399.article_body: Chennai division of Southern Railway will levy a fine of ₹2,000 on individuals caught taking selfies on railway tracks or near locomotives. Additionally, people caught travelling on footboards will be punished with either a prison term of up to three months or a ₹500 fine. The move comes weeks after an accident on railway tracks in Chengalpattu claimed three lives.

400.title: Will follow SC order on Jahangirpuri but drive to continue: NDMC Mayor
400.article_body: The North Delhi Municipal Corporation will follow the Supreme Court's order and not conduct the anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri, the civic body's Mayor Raja Iqbal Singh said on Thursday. "I also want to clarify that the civic body will keep taking action against encroachers. We will identify illegal encroachments and send notices to them and take action," Singh said.

401.title: CSK's Chris Jordan has conceded runs as if they were on sale: Harbhajan
401.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the performances of CSK pacer Chris Jordan who conceded 58 runs in the franchise's last IPL 2022 match against GT, Harbhajan Singh said Jordan has conceded runs as if they were "on sale". "Jordan needs to sit back and think about his own game," added Harbhajan. CSK will take on MI today.

402.title: AAP politicising police: Sidhu after Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas
402.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday said the AAP government is politicising the police force to use it for their own interests and to target those who raise their voice against AAP's Arvind Kejriwal. This comes after Punjab Police booked Kumar Vishwas over "inflammatory statements" against Kejriwal. "Punjab's CM has become a 'rubber da gudda' (rubber doll)," Sidhu added.
